Our prime objective is to relieve people of their pain and restore their mobility. As a specialist clinic, we focus on surgical orthopedics, neurology, rheumatology and sports medicine. The Schulthess Clinic is a Swiss Olympic Medical Center.   You too can become part of our leading orthopedic clinic as a     Your tasks    Defining and writing the study protocol Analysing existing radiographs and clinical data usings state of the art machine learning and deep learning techniques Collaborating with clinical experts  Writing manuscripts on your project Presenting your work at conferences      Your profile    Qualifications   Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Computational Biology and Bioinformatics, Health Sciences and Technology or related fields Strong programming skills in Python Excellent written and oral communication skills in English Willingness and passion to learn about biomedical applications of machine learning and deep learning models Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment Motivation, curiosity and willingness to learn   Preferred Qualifications   Project experiences in developing deep learning models Experience developing machine learning and deep learning models (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch) Experience working with large datasets, high-performance computing environments, and Linux operating systems Experience analyzing and working with imaging data (e.g., radiographs)      We offer    Opportunities to engage with different communities bridging machine learning and health research, leading to high-impact publications in machine learning, computer science and/or healthcare oriented venues. You will be part of a highly motivated, friendly and collaborative team. We will support your scientific career. You will be able to attend relevant (inter-)national conferences to increase your visibility and present the project outcomes. You will be involved in the supervision of undergraduate students and are also offered the possibility to be involved in teaching activities in the lab. We offer a flexible hybrid working environment. Start is January 2025 or by agreement.Please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. "Job Title" : "Postdoctoral position in entropy enhanced defects for sustainable catalysis"
"Company" : "EMPA"
"Veröffentlicht" : "14 August 2024"
"Pensum" : "100%"
"Vertrag" : "Festanstellung"
"Arbeitsort" : "Ueberlandstrasse 129, 8600 Dübendorf"
"Text" : "Postdoctoral position in entropy enhanced defects for sustainable catalysis EMPABewerbenJob merkenAuf einen BlickVeröffentlicht:14 August 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:Ueberlandstrasse 129, 8600 Dübendorf             Postdoctoral position in entropy enhanced defects for sustainable catalysis      Materials science and technology are our passion. With our cutting-edge research, Empa's around 1,100 employees make essential contributions to the well-being of society for a future worth living. Empa is a research institution of the ETH Domain. The   Laboratory for Computational Engineering    focuses on developing technologies that support energy transition and a sustainable society by devising novel approaches and algorithms to help research in strategic areas (porous materials science, carbon negative technologies, and renewable energy integration), employing numerical simulations to understand complex systems and processes, and solving practically relevant problems to support a sustainable and healthy society. The laboratory has an extensive experience in investigating coupled multiphysics phenomena and complex multiscale processes, as well as in developing and using innovative scientific computing techniques (including HPC, machine learning, multiscale algorithms). It also has excellent experimental infrastructures (including cutting-edge experimental fluid dynamics facilities, and various equipment to investigate processes in porous materials) that used to advance electro-optical methods and to devise machine learning methods for data analysis and control. Your tasks The postdoctoral researcher will work on quantum chemical (QC) modeling of amorphous materials and undercoordinated defects on oxidic surfaces. The postdoc will work in a team of scientists with diverse backgrounds and will tightly interact with experimentalists. In this project, by comparing modeling results and experiments, we aim to establish a framework to digitally accelerate the design of sustainable amorphous catalysts by integrating computational and analytical methods. Your profile The applicants must hold a recent PhD degree, preferably in physics, chemical engineering, materials science, or mechanical engineering. Knowledge of the theory and demonstrated proficiency with QC modeling is mandatory for this position: the candidate must have an excellent record of accomplishments and publications (for the corresponding career stage) that proves an extensive hands-on experience and the ability to autonomously work with QC codes (e.g., CP2K, Quantum Espresso, or VASP). Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and experience in dealing with real data are an asset. The candidate is a curious, passionate, and proactive individual that can autonomously advance the project, engaging in discussion with the other members of the research team. Our offer We offer internationally competitive conditions, optimal computational and experimental facilities, and the opportunity to work in a multidisciplinary environment where communication and interaction to create synergies and develop novel ideas are highly valued. The position is available for two years starting in fall upon mutual agreement. We live a culture of inclusion and respect. We welcome all people who are interested in innovative, sustainable and meaningful activities - that's what counts. We are looking forward to receiving your application comprising a letter of motivation, a brief statement of your research interest (please provide it in the same PDF as the motivation letter), your curriculum vitae, a complete list of publications, and two or more references with contact details. Please submit these exclusively via our job portal. Applications by e-mail and by post will not be considered.   Patricia Nitzsche,Stv. Leiterin Human Resources / Dep. "Job Title" : "Postdoctoral position on societal dynamics in the energy-materials-humans nexus"
"Company" : "EMPA"
"Veröffentlicht" : "14 August 2024"
"Pensum" : "100%"
"Vertrag" : "Festanstellung"
"Arbeitsort" : "Ueberlandstrasse 129, 8600 Dübendorf"
"Text" : "Postdoctoral position on societal dynamics in the energy-materials-humans nexus EMPABewerbenJob merkenAuf einen BlickVeröffentlicht:14 August 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:Ueberlandstrasse 129, 8600 Dübendorf             Postdoctoral position on societal dynamics in the energy-materials-humans nexus      Materials science and technology are our passion. With our cutting-edge research, Empa's around 1,100 employees make essential contributions to the well-being of society for a future worth living. Empa is a research institution of the ETH Domain. The   Laboratory for Computational Engineering    focuses on developing technologies that support energy transition and a sustainable society by devising novel approaches and algorithms to help research in strategic areas (porous materials science, carbon negative technologies, and renewable energy integration), employing numerical simulations to understand complex systems and processes, and solving practically relevant problems to support a sustainable and healthy society. The laboratory has an extensive experience in investigating coupled multiphysics phenomena and complex multiscale processes, as well as in developing and using innovative scientific computing techniques (including HPC, machine learning, multiscale algorithms). It also has excellent experimental infrastructures (including cutting-edge experimental fluid dynamics facilities, and various equipment to investigate processes in porous materials) that used to advance electro-optical methods and to devise machine learning methods for data analysis and control. Your tasks The postdoctoral researcher will work in a multidisciplinary team aiming at a holistic approach to model the technological landscape of a carbon-negative society, hence, approaching energy systems, materials fluxes, and social aspects from a systemic perspective which transcends the traditional silos. The postdoc will tightly collaborate with two other postdoctoral researchers, and will focus on (i) developing mathematical models (e.g., compartment models, network models, etc.) to explore the dynamics dominating opinion spreading and technology adoption across the society; (ii) describing the role of spatiotemporal heterogeneity on energy and material fluxes; (iii) coupling and integrating the individual system models (materials, energy, humans). The project will provide the bases to integrate and optimize carbon-negative technologies into planetary-scale systems. Your profile The applicants must hold a recent PhD degree, preferably in physics, system engineering, computer science, mathematics, or related disciplines. A strong background in computational science and good intuition for physical systems are mandatory. The ideal candidate has demonstrated proficiency and hands-on experience with network and compartment models, as well as an excellent record of accomplishments and publications (for the corresponding career stage). Experience with societal modeling and dynamics is an asset. The candidate is a curious, passionate, and proactive individual that can autonomously advance the project, engaging in discussion with the other members of the research team. Our offer We offer internationally competitive conditions, optimal computational and experimental facilities, and the opportunity to work in a multidisciplinary environment where communication and interaction to create synergies and develop novel ideas are highly valued. The position is available for two years from fall upon mutual agreement. We live a culture of inclusion and respect. We welcome all people who are interested in innovative, sustainable and meaningful activities - that's what counts. We are looking forward to receiving your application comprising a letter of motivation, a brief statement of your research interest(please provide it in the same PDF as the motivation letter), your curriculum vitae, a complete list of publications, and two or more references with contact details.   Patricia Nitzsche,Stv. Leiterin Human Resources / Dep. "Text" : "Software Engineer / AI Ops (m/f) 80-100% AutoForm Development  GmbHSchnell bewerbenJob merkenAuf einen BlickVeröffentlicht:26 Juli 2024Pensum:80 – 100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:Technoparkstrasse 1, 8005 Zürich Successful with AutoForm!  AutoForm offers software solutions for sheet metal forming and BiW assembly process. With over 400 employees dedicated to this field, AutoForm is recognized as the leading provider of software for product manufacturability, tool and material cost calculation, die face design and virtual stamping as well as BiW assembly process optimization. All of the Top 20 automotive OEMs and most of their suppliers have selected AutoForm as their software of choice. Besides its headquarters in Switzerland, AutoForm has offices in Germany, The Netherlands, France, Spain, Italy, Czech Republic, Sweden, USA, Mexico, Brazil, India, China, Japan and Korea. AutoFormers are key to our success. Our vision is to attract, develop and retain high caliber professionals by providing challenging opportunities in an exciting and progressive work environment. Our software spans a broad range of technologies: finite element simulation, computer aided design and engineering, process simulation, data analytics, machine learning, high performance computing, 3D visualization and many more. Our Scrum based development is supported by sophisticated DevOps build, quality and release systems. Learn more about   AutoForm   .  AutoForm's AI revolution in numerical simulation  AutoForm is pioneering the transformation of engineering simulations using advanced AI technology. Our innovative approach not only enhances the efficiency and accuracy of simulation technology, but also simplifies and accelerates the day-to-day tasks of our users with real, fully functional applications. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to work on ground-breaking innovations in a dynamic setting. As we expand our capabilities in the field of AI and in order to support our R&D Departement in Zürich, we are looking for a Tasks    Develop and maintain data generation workflows for internal FEM simulations, computer vision and geometry modeling datasets Automate model training and versioning to foster development experiments on AI field within the company projects Implement data governance to ensure security and confidentiality of both the input data and the resulting models Participate in the transformation of our CI/CD infrastructure with cloud technologies Support the development teams with their automation tasks   Your profile   B.Sc. or higher degree in computer science, engineering or natural science At least two years experience in machine learning workflows using Kubernetes, and working with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, and scikit-learn Strong background in container-based development and orchestration tools for Kubernetes and Docker Knowledge of Infrastructure as a Code tools such as Terraform Experience with automation tools such as Jenkins, Argo, Kubeflow is a plus Strong technical interest, willingness to get involved in complex technical issues Team player with a strong commitment to problem solving Good knowledge of English required. German would be a plus   Our offer   A challenging role in a respectful and global working environment Being part of a world-leading, high-end CAE software company Working on cutting edge technologies for the automotive industry Professional development and continuous education Excellent balance between your working life and your private life through flexible home office and flexible working hours   Start of work is as soon as possible. Please note that we only consider applicants that have the legal right to work in Switzerland. We will only consider direct applications. Die KMS AG ist eine höchst innovative Softwareentwicklungsunternehmung mit mehr als 40 Jahren Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Business Lösungen für Steuerverwaltungen. Du fragst dich, was daran cool ist? Wenn du in einem höchst professionellen Umfeld arbeiten möchtest, dir ein aufgeschlossenes und unkompliziertes Teamwork wichtig ist und dein tägliches Engagement mit attraktiven Konditionen wertgeschätzt werden soll, bist du hier genau richtig. In dieser spannenden Funktion übernimmst du eine wichtige Rolle in der Weiterentwicklung unserer Softwarelösungen. Vom Design bis hin zur Entwicklung und Architektur treibst du wichtige Projekte auf Unternehmensebene voran. Wir suchen eine Person mit viel Eigeninitiative, die ihre kreativen Ideen in den Innovationsprojekten einbringen und ihre Begeisterung für Development ausleben möchte (Bsp. Einbindung von KI/AI Tools). Erkennst du dich als KMSler:in wieder? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!      Was bewegst Du bei uns?   Als erfahrene:r Developer:in arbeitest du primär in unseren agilen Entwicklungsteams mit und bist mitverantwortlich für das Design und die Architektur von Softwarelösungen, welche durch Innovation einem Grossteil Schweizer Steuerämter einen bedeutenden Mehrwert bieten.   Du übernimmst den technischen Lead für die Umsetzung bedeutender Arbeitspakete innerhalb deines agilen Entwicklungsteams und begleitest deine Kolleginnen und Kollegen in der Gestaltung und Weiterentwicklung unserer marktführender Softwarelösung.   Mit deiner Expertise stärkst du die individuelle Weiterentwicklung jedes einzelnen im Team, indem du in Reviews oder im Pair Programming wertvolles, konstruktives und wertschätzendes Feedback vermittelst.   Du kannst dich im agilen Team und in der ganzen Firma entfalten. Im Rahmen unseres Lean-Prozesses kannst du einen Tag im Monat an von dir mitgestalteten Ideen für Optimierungen im Bereich Prozesse, Lean Consumption, Ticket-Qualität, etc. arbeiten.   Zudem hast du die Möglichkeit in temporären Projektteams an gesamtarchitektonischen Visionen, innovativen Weblösungen (Angular, Docker, Kubernetes) oder an Innovationsprojekten mit Künstlicher Intelligenz (Generative AI, Machine Learning) mitzuwirken.      Was bringst Du mit?   Du verfügst über einen höheren Abschluss im Bereich der Informatik auf Stufe FH/Uni/ETH mit Schwerpunkt Softwareentwicklung oder einen vergleichbaren Leistungsnachweis.   Mit deiner fundierten Erfahrung in der agilen Softwareentwicklung, konntest du deine Expertise in Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedensten Sparring-Partner ausbauen und anspruchsvolle Projekte erfolgreich umsetzen.   Du verfügst über ein vertieftest Wissen in C#, .NET8, SQL, DI, Testautomation, Continuous Integration, Docker und Git. Erfahrung mit Angular, Kubernetes, Generative AI oder Machine Learning ist ein weiteres Plus.   Du legst grossen Wert auf hohe Code-Qualität, hast denselben Anspruch an deine Kolleg:innen und förderst diesen Aspekt proaktiv innerhalb des Teams. Dabei sind Commit Reviews für dich eine Selbstverständlichkeit sowie die Entwicklung sauberer und nachhaltigen Lösungen nach Clean Code und SOLID Prinzipien.   Mit deiner Power inspirierst du Teammitglieder durch deinen Drive und mit deinen innovativen Ideen. Du bist in der Lage, den Weg mit Entschlossenheit voranzugehen.   Du bist ambitioniert dich innerhalb und neben deinem Job kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln. Retroperspektiven und Feedbacks nutzt du, um zu wachsen und integrierst wertvolle Erkenntnisse in deinem Skillset.     Das bieten wir!    Flexibilität: In der KMS AG arbeiten wir in einer 40 Stundenwoche und bieten selbstverständlich Home-Office.    Investitionen: Wir sind daran interessiert, dass du dein volles Potenzial entfalten kannst, finanzieren berufsrelevante Aus- und Weiterbildungen und zahlen überdurchschnittliche Versicherungsleistungen sowie Treueprämien.    Mobilität: Deine Kosten fürs Halbtax-Abo sowie für deine Autobahnvignette werden übernommen. Zudem profitierst du von Ermässigung auf Reka-Guthaben und Parkplätze stehen kostenlos zur Verfügung.    Erholung: Nebst deinen regulären Ferien erhältst du bis zu 10 zusätzliche Ferientage (gestaffelt nach Dienstjahren)    Kulinarium: Täglich stehen gratis frische Gipfeli, angerichtete Früchteplatten, Süssigkeiten und alles war dein Herz begehrt bereit. In unseren eigenen Restaurants verwöhnen dich zur Mittagszeit unsere Küchenteams mit köstlichen Spezialitäten.     Willst du Teil unseres Teams werden? Nous guidons nos client-es depuis l'exploration jusqu'à la mise en oeuvre réussie de solutions personnalisées en Intelligence Artificielle et Machine Learning, incluant des services de conseil stratégique, de développement et de formation. Nous sommes une équipe d'expert-es passionné-es par l'IA, engagé-es dans l'apprentissage continu et la création de valeur pour nos client-es. Novatix fait désormais partie du groupe Ansam, un leader des services informatiques et de digitalisation en Suisse Romande.  Résumé du Poste  Le-la Lead Generation Specialist - Stagiaire est chargé-e de générer des opportunités commerciales et de nourrir le sales funnel en identifiant et qualifiant des leads dans le domaine de l'IA.  Responsabilités Principales   Génération de Leads et Prospection :   Identifier et cibler des leads dans les secteurs de l'IA, principalement via des campagnes d'e-mailing, les réseaux sociaux, et le marketing de contenu. Suivre et analyser l'efficacité des campagnes de génération de leads. Qualifier les leads en fonction de leurs besoins et de leur potentiel. Développer et entretenir une base de données de leads et de prospects qualifiés dans le CRM.   Collaboration Interne et Reporting :   Collaborer avec l'équipe de vente pour assurer une transition fluide des leads qualifiés. Participer à des réunions de stratégie pour affiner les cibles et les approches de prospection. Rapporter régulièrement les performances en matière de génération de leads et fournir des insights sur le marché à la direction.   Qualifications Requises :   Diplôme de Bachelor en Business Administration, Ventes, Marketing ou dans un domaine pertinent. Expérience démontrée en prospection et génération de leads, idéalement dans le domaine technologique ou de l'IA. Maîtrise des systèmes CRM (HubSpot). Compréhension des principes de l'Intelligence Artificielle. Capacité à travailler de manière autonome et à gérer plusieurs tâches simultanément. Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais. Hier findest du alles, was dein Techie-Herz begehrt: In einem dynamischen und kollegialen Umfeld treibst du deine innovativen Ideen voran – natürlich immer mithilfe der neuesten Technologien. Apropos Arbeitsplatzkultur: Agilität fordern wir nicht nur bei unseren Projekten, sondern fördern sie auch für unsere Mitarbeitenden. Mit ti&m liquid working bieten wir einfach anpassbare Arbeitszeitmodelle und die Möglichkeit, Auszeiten zu nehmen. Und mit unserer ti&m academy entscheidest du, wo und wie du dich weiterbilden willst. Philipp Klein Fragen zu deiner Bewerbung? Unser HR-Team hilft dir gerne weiter. Mit exzellenten Bachelor- und Masterstudiengängen sowie Weiterbildungen auf der Höhe der Zeit bilden wir zukunftsorientierte Fach- und Führungskräfte aus. Im Bereich der anwendungsorientierten Forschung und Entwicklung sowie Dienstleistungen gehören wir national zu den führenden Institutionen. Das Institut für Computational Engineering ICE beschäftigt sich mit anspruchsvollen Herausforderungen in den Bereichen Scientific Computing, Materialmodellierung, Prozesssimulation sowie der industriellen Anwendung von künstlicher Intelligenz (Industrial AI). Wir suchen per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung Sie als Senior Research Data Scientist/in | ML-Engineer im Bereich Industrielle Künstliche Intelligenz (Industrial AI) (80 – 100%).  Als Senior Research Data Scientist/in im Kompetenzbereich «Industrial AI» agieren Sie als Experten/in in den Bereichen Machine Learning und Deep Learning wobei sie unsere Partner in anwendungsorientierten Forschungs- und Entwicklungsprojekten unterstützen. In Ihrer Rolle übernehmen Sie die Projektverantwortung sowie die fachliche Führung von wissenschaftlichen Projektmitarbeitern. Diese interessante Tätigkeit bietet Ihnen Freiräume, um fachlich auf dem aktuellen Stand der Entwicklung mitzuarbeiten, Forschungsprojekte zu akquirieren und damit innovative KI-Lösungen für unterschiedlichste Industrien zu entwickeln.Ihre Aufgaben:  Leitung und Durchführen von Forschungs- und Entwicklungsprojekten im Bereich Industrial AI. Unterstützung bei der Akquise von Forschungs- und Dienstleistungsprojekten Koordination der Zusammenarbeit in interdisziplinären Teams sowie Führung und Mentoring von Junior Data Scientists und Doktoranden. Aktive Weiterentwicklung des Kompetenzbereiches Industrial AI durch das Etablieren modernster AI-Methoden und Technologien Publikation von Forschungsergebnissen in renommierten Fachzeitschriften und Präsentation auf internationalen Konferenzen  Ihre Qualifikation:  Promotion (Ph.D.) oder Masterabschluss (M.Sc.) in Informatik, Mathematik, Data Science oder einem verwandten Bereich mit Schwerpunkt auf Maschinellem Lernen und Künstlicher Intelligenz Ausgewiesene Erfahrung als Leiter von Entwicklungs- oder Forschungsprojekten im Bereich Industrial AI, von der Konzeption bis zur Umsetzung Hervorragendes Fachwissen im Bereich Maschinelles Lernen, insbesondere in neuronalen Netzwerken, natürlicher Sprachverarbeitung, Zeitreihenanalyse, Bilderkennung und generativen Modellen Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse in relevanten Programmiersprachen für KI (wie Python, SQL, C++ oder Java) sowie in ML/DL-Frameworks (wie TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras) und gängigen MLOps-Prozessen (CI/CD, Containerization, Orchestrierung, Model Training, Validation & Monitoring) Gute Vernetzung in der Industrie mit Erfahrung in der Akquise von Fördermitteln für die Zusammenarbeit zwischen akademischen und industriellen Partnern  Wir bieten:  Wirkungsbereich in einem dynamischen Umfeld mit moderner Infrastruktur Zukunftsweisende und anspruchsvolle Tätigkeit mit hoher Eigenverantwortung an einer attraktiven Hochschule Enge Zusammenarbeit in einem engagierten interdisziplinären Team sowie mit Forschungs- und Industriepartnern Persönliche und fachliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum  Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt und verfügen Sie über die gewünschte Qualifikation? "Text" : " Chief Medical Information Officer 80-100% Luzerner KantonsspitalBewerbenJob merkenAuf einen BlickVeröffentlicht:31 Juli 2024Pensum:80 – 100%Vertrag:FestanstellungSprache:Englisch (Fliessend), Deutsch (Fliessend)Arbeitsort:Luzern  Die Luzerner Kantonspitalgruppe ist mit ihren Standorten in Luzern, Sursee, Stans und Wolhusen die führende Spitalgruppe der Zentralschweiz. Die über 8000 Mitarbeitenden in den Kliniken und Instituten der LUKS-Gruppe bieten am Standort Luzern hochqualitative Spitzenmedizin eines universitären Lehr- und Forschungsspitals und über das Netzwerk an den Standorten durch interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit alle Leistungen der wohnortnahen Grund- und Regelversorgung an. Als erstes Spital der Schweiz steuert das Gesamtunternehmen seit 2019 die klinischen Behandlungs- und Supportprozesse über das EPIC-Klinikinformationssystem. Im Rahmen der werteorientierten Weiterentwicklung unserer Patientenversorgung, sowie der Weiterführung der digitalen Transformation des Konzerns, suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n   Ihr Wirkungsfeld      Als Chief Medical Information Officer verkörpern Sie kompromisslos das digitale Mindset und die Innovationskultur einer akademischen zukunftsorientierten Spitalgruppe. Sie sind Visionär, Innovator, Stratege, Prozessoptimierer und Transformator. Ihre Aufgabe ist es, eingebettet in den gesamtunternehmerischen Visionsrahmen und die Unternehmensstrategie, alle ärztlich-medizinischen digitalen Themen im Unternehmen koordinierend voranzutreiben, die Mitarbeitenden auf dem Weg in die digitale Spitalzukunft mitzunehmen und die Leistungsfähigkeit des Unternehmens nachhaltig zu verbessern. Sie unterstützen die Umsetzung der von der Geschäftsleitung entwickelten Digitalisierungsstrategie und wirken am Aufbau des Telehealth-Centers der LUKS-Gruppe mit. Sie wirken als Change Agent bei der Identifizierung, Entwicklung, Planung, Umsetzung und Wertmessung von Systemen zur Unterstützung einer qualitativ hochwertigen Patientenversorgung mit und fungieren als strategisches Bindeglied über die ärztlichen klinischen Organisationsstrukturen hinweg. Sie kooperieren mit den leitenden ärztlichen Führungskräften bei der Einführung digitaler, standardisierter, evidenzbasierter Best Practices in der Medizin und unterstützen die Fachabteilungen bei der Entwicklung und Implementierung von neuen zukunftsweisenden Behandlungsmodellen.    Ihre Erfahrung      Sie sind Arzt/Ärztin mit mehrjähriger klinischer Erfahrung sowie Master-Abschluss (oder vergleichbarem Abschluss) in Healthcare-Management, medizinischer Informatik oder Betriebswirtschaft. Sie bringen Erfahrung in der Anwendung und dem Betrieb des Klinikinformationssystems EPIC mit und besitzen tiefgreifende Kenntnisse der klinischen Arbeitsabläufe und des Technologiebedarfs im stationären und ambulanten Kontext einer Spitalgruppe oder eines Grossspitals. Sie haben Erfahrung mit der Standardisierung und Konsolidierung von organisationsweiten Informationssystemen sowie fortgeschrittene Führungs- und Managementfähigkeiten von multidisziplinären Teams. Sie bringen Aufgeschlossenheit, Überzeugungskraft, Veränderungsbereitschaft, Empathie und eine gute Frustrationstoleranz mit um in einem komplexen, sich kon-tinuierlich verändernden akademischen Umfeld zu agieren. Sie sind in der Lage, komplexe Herausforderungen zu analysieren, auf den Kern zu reduzieren, für andere zu übersetzen und gemeinsam Lösungen zu entwickeln. Sie besitzen eine hohe Integrität und Vertrauenswürdigkeit und ein sehr gutes Kommunikationstalent um mit Mitarbeitenden, internen und externen Stakeholder-Gruppen handlungsorientiert und ergebnisorientiert zu interagieren. Uneingeschränkte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Englisch sowie Kenntnisse der deutschen Sprache werden vorausgesetzt.    Ihre Perspektiven      Sie treiben den Aufbau forschungsspezifischer Plattformen voran und betreuen wissenschaftliche Kooperationen mit anderen Organisationen des Gesundheitswesens, Start-Ups und Industriepartnern. Sie führen ein Team von ärztlichen EPIC-Champions und Physician Builders (ca. 35 Personen), haben eine enge fachliche Zusammenarbeit mit den EPIC Product Owners und Applikations-Analysten und treiben gemeinsam die intelligente Vernetzung relevanter medizinischer Daten für Prävention und Diagnose über den Einsatz von Machine Learning in der Pathologie, Radiologie und Genetik bis zur algorithmusbasierten Auswertung von Daten aus stationären und mobilen Digital-Devices voran. Im Rahmen Ihrer Tätigkeit berichten Sie direkt an den CMO, welchem Sie unterstellt sind, und arbeiten eng mit CAIO, CTIO, CNIO/NIS zusammen. Die Stelle des/der CMIO ist eine 80-100%-Stelle, wobei optional eine 20-30%-ige klinische Tätigkeit im jeweiligen Fachgebiet angeboten wird.  Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständige online Bewerbung. Bei Fragen wenden Sie sich bitte an Professor Dr. med. Katrin Hoffmann, MBA Chief Medical, Tel: 041 205 4206 /079 463 23 00, E-Mail: E-Mail schreiben. Wenn du in einem höchst professionellen Umfeld arbeiten möchtest, dir ein aufgeschlossenes und unkompliziertes Teamwork wichtig ist und dein tägliches Engagement mit attraktiven Konditionen wertgeschätzt werden soll, bist du hier genau richtig. Zur Verstärkung unserer Teams mit insgesamt 140 engagierten Mitarbeitenden an den Standorten Kriens (Luzern), Matzingen (Thurgau) und Wiedikon (Zürich) suchen wir dich als Professional Developer:in C# und .NET an unseren Standorten Kriens oder Matzingen. Als Teil eines grossartigen Teams, wo Teamgeist und persönliche Entwicklung im Mittelpunkt stehen, übernimmst du eine wichtige Rolle in der Weiterentwicklung unserer Softwarelösungen. Anhand von User Stories leistest du deinen wertvollen Beitrag vom Refinement, über das Pre-Design bis hin zur Entwicklung und Review. Gemeinsam bringen wir die Projekte auf Unternehmensebene zum Erfolg. Bist du bereit, deine mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung in unserem agilen Umfeld zielführend einzusetzen und erkennst dich KMSler:in wieder? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!      Was bewegst Du bei uns?   Als wichtiger Teil unserer agilen Entwicklungsteams bist du mitverantwortlich für die Erweiterung und Wartung komplexer Softwarelösungen, welche durch Innovation einem Grossteil Schweizer Steuerämter einen bedeutenden Mehrwert bieten.   In unserem professionellen Entwicklungsprozess übernimmst du Mitverantwortung für die technische Umsetzung User Stories und wirkst in interdisziplinären Teams mit, die Sprints erfolgreich abzuschliessen.   Mit deinen ausgereiften Skills entwickelst du innerhalb unseres Technologie-Stacks mit C#, .NET8, SQL und bringst mit hoher Eigenmotivation neue und frische Ideen ein, um den Entwicklungsprozess in deinem Team weiter zu verfeinern.   Zudem hast du die Möglichkeit in temporären Projektteams an gesamtarchitektonischen Visionen, innovativen Weblösungen (Angular, Docker, Kubernetes) oder an Innovationsprojekten mit künstlicher Intelligenz (Generative AI, Machine Learning) mitzuwirken.     Was bringst Du mit?   Du verfügst über einen höheren Abschluss im Bereich der Informatik auf Stufe FH/Uni/ETH mit Schwerpunkt Softwareentwicklung oder einen vergleichbaren Leistungsnachweis.   Mit deiner mehrjährigen Erfahrung in der agilen Softwareentwicklung, konntest du bereits anspruchsvolle Projekte erfolgreich umsetzen und kamst dabei in Kontakt mit Testautomatisierungen, Continuous Integration und Git.   Als leidenschaftlicher Softwareentwickler hast du ein hohes Qualitätsverhalten, committest sauberen und verständlichen Code und weisst, wann und weshalb du Unit-, Integration und Akzeptanztests entwickeln solltest.   Nebst der Softwareentwicklung kannst du dich für die Fachlichkeit begeistern. In dieser Kombination verstehst du den Sinn und Mehrwert unserer Softwarepalette und kannst auf technischer und fachlicher Ebene einen wertvollen Beitrag leisten.   Du schliesst deine Aufgaben selbständig und kannst proaktiv Unterstützung einfordern. Das Team unterstützt du mit deiner Verlässlichkeit, indem du ein Commitment abgibst und einhältst.     Das bieten wir!     Flexibilität: In der KMS AG arbeiten wir in einer 40 Stundenwoche und bieten selbstverständlich Home-Office.      Investitionen: Wir sind daran interessiert, dass du dein volles Potenzial entfalten kannst, finanzieren berufsrelevante Aus- und Weiterbildungen und zahlen überdurchschnittliche Versicherungsleistungen sowie Treueprämien.      Mobilität: Deine Kosten fürs Halbtax-Abo sowie für deine Autobahnvignette werden übernommen. Zudem profitierst du von Ermässigung auf Reka-Guthaben und Parkplätze stehen kostenlos zur Verfügung.      Erholung: Nebst deinen regulären Ferien erhältst du bis zu 10 zusätzliche Ferientage (gestaffelt nach Dienstjahren)      Kulinarium: Täglich stehen gratis frische Gipfeli, angerichtete Früchteplatten, Süssigkeiten und alles war dein Herz begehrt bereit. In unseren eigenen Restaurants verwöhnen dich zur Mittagszeit unsere Küchenteams zu kostengünstigen Preisen.      Willst du Teil unseres Teams werden?  Sende uns deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit einem Klick auf den entsprechenden Button. AutoForm offers software solutions for sheet metal forming and BiW assembly process. With over 400 employees dedicated to this field, AutoForm is recognized as the leading provider of software for product manufacturability, tool and material cost calculation, die face design and virtual stamping as well as BiW assembly process optimization. All of the Top 20 automotive OEMs and most of their suppliers have selected AutoForm as their software of choice. Besides its headquarters in Switzerland, AutoForm has offices in Germany, The Netherlands, France, Spain, Italy, Czech Republic, Sweden, USA, Mexico, Brazil, India, China, Japan and Korea. AutoFormers are key to our success. Our vision is to attract, develop and retain high caliber professionals by providing challenging opportunities in an exciting and progressive work environment. Our software spans a broad range of technologies: finite element simulation, computer aided design and engineering, process simulation, data analytics, machine learning, high performance computing, 3D visualization and many more. "Job Title" : "PhD Student in Computational Snow Physics (100%)"
"Company" : "OST - Ostschweizer Fachhochschule"
"Veröffentlicht" : "19 Juli 2024"
"Pensum" : "100%"
"Vertrag" : "Festanstellung, Lehrstelle"

"Text" : " PhD Student in Computational Snow Physics (100%) OST - Ostschweizer FachhochschuleBewerbenJob merkenAuf einen BlickVeröffentlicht:19 Juli 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:Festanstellung, LehrstelleArbeitsort:Oberseestrasse 10, 8640 Rapperswil SGOST – Eastern Switzerland University of Applied Sciences, is the university of applied sciences for the six cantons of Eastern Switzerland and the Principality of Liechtenstein. We are an innovative and dynamic university with forward-thinking concepts and innovations, providing a major economic and social contribution to the development of Eastern Switzerland. With around 3,800 students spread across six Schools, 1,500 professionals pursuing executive education, and over 1,000 current research projects, we are Eastern Switzerland's regional educational hub. EPFL – École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne, is Europe’s most cosmopolitan technical university. EPFL collaborates with an important network of partners, including other universities and colleges, secondary schools and gymnasiums, industry and the economy, political circles, and the general public, with the aim of having a real impact on society. WSL Institute for Snow and Avalanche Research SLF in Davos studies snow, the atmosphere, natural hazards, permafrost, and mountain ecological systems. Per 1st of October 2024 or upon agreement we are looking for an enthusiastic  PhD Student in Computational Snow Physics (100%)   based at OST, Rapperswil, embedded into the doctoral school of EPFL, and collaborating with SLF.  The project: Snow is a highly dynamic porous material mainly made from ice. As the snow structure evolves via so-called snow metamorphism, so evolve macroscopic properties as e.g., radiative properties relevant for surface energy balances and remote sensing. However, the increased understanding of snow processes has not yet found its way into adequate representations at larger scales. One reason is the lack of sufficiently complete metamorphism models that allow for a direct link between ice crystal growth, sublimation, sintering, and bulk properties; another reason is the contrast between empirical approaches of classical snow science versus methods based on fundamental physics. Within a project financed by the Swiss National Science Foundation SNF, we strive to develop a versatile snow metamorphism model that is based on the phase-field methodology and to couple it to radiative transfer models. Comparison with data acquired in paralleling projects running at WSL/SLF and EPFL and analyses using machine learning shall be used to develop upscaling techniques and parametrizations for large scale predictions, e.g., in the context of photovoltaic installations in complex, snow covered terrain.  Your responsibilities:  Formulate a phase-field model that can predict close to isothermal snow metamorphism. In this case, the process can be interpreted as sintering, whereby intergranular and grain-boundary forces must be adequately considered. Rigid body forces, i.e., movement of individual ice crystals, will present additional challenges.  Parametrize the model to represent ice physics as accurately as possible or calibrate parameters using available experimental data. Perform sensitivity analyses to determine dominant driving forces and identify model simplifications while taking strong sensitivities adequately into account. Apply the model to small snow samples obtained from ?-CT and confront modeling results with existing measurement series. Contribute to the overarching project goals by collaborating within the 3-person project team and the partner institutes. Contribute, to a small extent, to teaching and tutoring at OST or EPFL in the context of the doctoral school.   Your qualifications:  Masters degree in physics, materials science, applied mathematics or equivalent Strong background in and flair for mathematical modelling and numerical simulation Interest in small-scale processes and their impact on large-scale properties, ideally linked to snow or other porous materials Eager to work in a multi-disciplinary context and multi-lingual environment and to collaborate with national and international partners Motivation to work at the interface between fundamental and applied sciences  We provide:  An independent job that offers both scope for personal initiative and the opportunity to exchange ideas with committed colleagues A family environment at an applied sciences university with attractive employment conditions Collaboration opportunities with SLF Davos, EPFL, and École Polytechnique Paris An attractive workplace on the shore of lake Zurich and in immediate vicinity of the Rapperswil train station and historic (small) town  Have we aroused your interest and do you have the desired qualifications? Then send us your complete application documents until 1st of September 2024 using our online tool ( jobs-ost.ch  ). For further information, please contact Prof. Dr. Thomas Kaempfer, OST, E-Mail schreiben, +41 79 626 46 37 or, for specific questions on the EPFL doctoral school, Prof. Dr. Michael Lehning, EPFL/SLF, E-Mail schreiben KontaktProf. Dr. Thomas Kaempfer+41 79 626 46 37OST - Ostschweizer Fachhochschule(0)22 Jobshttps://www.ost.ch/BewerbenJob merkenDiesen Job meldenWeitere relevante JobsuchenWissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter | Wissenschaftliche Angestellte | PhD Student | Wissenschaftlicher Assistent | Mitarbeiter | Doktorat | Forschung | Habilitation | Hilfsassistent | Hochschule | Oberassistent | Ph.D position | Postdoktorand | Promotionsstelle | ScienceKategorien:Verwaltung / Bildung / Soziales, Wissenschaft / Forschung"
}

Define the strategic direction and coordinate software development lifecycle at FIFA with focus on DevOps area.  Establish and implement the FIFA best practices with regards to DevOps across FIFA products.  Continuous improvement and maintenance of FIFA best practices by incorporating changes from your own research, feedback from agile product teams and other FIFA departments.  Making sure all agile product teams follow FIFA best practices regarding processes and technology.  Promote collaboration and coordinate activities for software development across all FIFA technology departments.  Conduct recurring assessments with agile product teams to evaluate their adherence to FIFA best practices and present the results of the assessments, including prioritization of next steps with the FIFA Product Manager.  Gather and present information regarding product health and quality (e.g., product KPIs) for FIFA management.  Responsible for the quality and technical approach taken by the agile product teams for FIFA products.  Evaluate new tools, technologies, and processes to enhance delivery process for all custom development across FIFA. Manage budget, suppliers, and contracts for software development   YOUR PROFILE  We work hard at FIFA.We are dedicated, ambitious and innovative.  And we respect our values. Always. For all roles, we seek talented people with an entrepreneurial spirit and a global mindset. The specific competencies we require for this position are:  5+ years of experience as a DevOps 2+ years of experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure DevOps 1+ years of experience with Terraform 1+ years of experience with Azure DevOps pipelines (YAML) Cloud Providers: Microsoft Azure (must have) / Amazon Web Service (nice to have)  Application Hosting: Kubernetes (Helm/Docker), Azure App Service, Virtual Machine  CI/CD: Azure DevOps (YAML) IaC: Terraform Logging: Splunk, Application Insights Programming Languages: Powershell, .NET, C#, SQL Tools: Azure DevOps, Sonar Cloud, Confluence/Atlassian, Prisma Cloud, LeanIX, Splunk, SignalFx , Edgio, AppScan, SendGrid Databases: Azure SQL Database  Ability to work efficiently and independently. Ability to identify important tasks, prioritizing them, and proactively determine areas requiring additional attention. Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with people at all organizational levels. Forward thinking to discover new patterns and opportunities. Pragmatic approach with defining new/adjusting existing standards and guidelines. Entrepreneurial, self-disciplined, detail-oriented and "lead by example" attitude. Proactivity of getting things done. Strong skills to adapt and evolve.   PERKS & BENEFITS  The biggest benefit of a career at FIFA is the privilege to work for the beautiful game and create something that matters. Continuous learning: We care about your development and encourage internal mobility, offering a variety of training and education to help achieve it. Volunteering: Make an impact beyond your regular role and bond with colleagues by volunteering with one of our partners. Position Overview  The Machine Learning Engineer, with moderate guidance from more experienced engineers, works individually and in collaboration with others on multiple projects which are moderate to complex in scope. This role utilizes working knowledge of advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms and models to solve problems involving biological, genomic, clinical and healthcare data within a setting of advanced cancer screening and precision oncology. This role is involved at every step of the solution development process, from ideation, design, implementation and deployment. This position contributes to the strategic vision for the application of cutting-edge AI methodologies at Exact Sciences and works as a partner with biostatisticians, bioinformatics scientists, and data scientists to further our goal of helping eradicate cancer by preventing it, detecting it earlier, and guiding personalized treatment.    Essential Duties  Include, but are not limited to, the following:  Keep up with external and internal advances in AI technology. Machine Learning Engineer:    Are you fascinated by machine learning and building robust machine learning pipelines which process massive amounts of data at scale and speed to provide crucial insights to the end consumers?   This is exactly what we, the Machine Learning Engineering group in Expedia, do. "Text" : "Lead Machine Learning EngineerExact Sciences International GmbHBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:22 August 2024Pensum:100%Arbeitsort:La Jolla - 11085 N Torrey Pines RdLead Machine Learning Engineer  Help us change lives  At Exact Sciences, we’re helping change how the world prevents, detects and guides treatment for cancer. We give patients and clinicians the clarity needed to make confident decisions when they matter most. Join our team to find a purpose-driven career, an inclusive culture, and robust benefits to support your life while you’re working to help others.    Position Overview  The Lead Machine Learning Engineer is largely self-driven, working in collaboration with others on one or more projects which are extremely complex in scope. This role is responsible for successfully leading the planning and execution of projects. Working in a team setting, this position applies deep knowledge of advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms and models to solve complex problems involving biological, genomic, clinical and healthcare data within a setting of advanced cancer screening and precision oncology. This position provides technical leadership at every step of the solution development process, from ideation, design, implementation and deployment. The Lead Machine Learning Engineer will help craft the strategic vision for the application of cutting-edge AI methodologies at Exact Sciences and work as a partner with biostatisticians, bioinformatics scientists, and data scientists to further our goal of helping eradicate cancer by preventing it, detecting it earlier, and guiding personalized treatment.      Essential Duties  Include, but are not limited to, the following:  Lead development of perspectives on technology “affordance”: what do these advances in AI technology allow us to do (more efficiently and / or more effectively) that we couldn’t do before Work with stakeholders to identify, refine, prioritize and formalize requirements for ML- and AI-based solutions to business problems with a focus on bioinformatics, biostatistics and data engineering applications. Collaborate with other ML/AI engineers and relevant partners to provide technical and strategic leadership for the design of software solutions that utilize state-of-the art artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques. Work with other AI and ML engineers and software engineers to lead the implementation and deployment of ML and AI solutions. Set up Agile framework focused on delivering iterative, “rapid” solutions that demonstrate the promise of selected AI technologies. Provide leadership in the development of an AI strategy at Exact Sciences that empowers the team to leverage both existing AI and ML tools and those developed in-house to accelerate and enhance bioinformatics, biostatistics and data science processes and outcomes. Lead internal initiatives to build training resources, develop knowledge bases, and educate on advanced AI and ML technologies and best practices for leveraging them. Lead “AI evangelism” for biostatistics, bioinformatics and data science at Exact Sciences. Assist team to solve complex problems using sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgement and identify innovative solution Provide mentorship and coaching to more junior level team members. Act as resource and subject matter expert in core team and/or cross-functional meetings. Contribute to the intellectual property portfolio by implementing innovative and creative ideas to solve problems or improve on current methods. Exercise discretion and judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining and interpreting results. Ability to effectively communicate, influence decision-making, and explain difficult, sensitive, and/or highly complex information to audiences of peers. Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork. Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures. Maintain regular and reliable attendance. Ability to act with an inclusion mindset and model these behaviors for the organization. Ability to work designated schedule. Ability to work on a mobile device, tablet, or in front of a computer screen and/or perform typing for approximately 85% of a typical working day. Ability to travel 5% of working time away from work location, may include overnight/weekend travel.     Minimum Qualifications   Ph.D in Statistics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, or related quantitative field as outlined in the essential duties, or Master’s Degree in Statistics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, or related quantitative field as outlined in the essential duties plus 4 years of relevant experience. 5+ years of experience in statistics, computational biology, applied mathematics, or related quantitative field as outlined in the essential duties. 5+ years of experience with artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms. Demonstrated experience with and mastery of advanced AI concepts, such as artificial neural networks, deep learning, and reinforcement learning. Demonstrated experience with and mastery of artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques within one or more of the following fields: natural language processing, image processing and computer vision, image and pattern recognition. Demonstrated experience with and mastery of large language models for generative AI and associated concepts, such as transformer architecture and retrieval augmented generation. Strong programming ability with demonstrated experience in Python and one or more associated machine learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or SKLearn. Knowledge and experience working with open-source AI models. Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics to audiences of varied backgrounds. Demonstrated ability to perform the essential duties of the position with or without accommodation. Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship.     Preferred Qualifications   3+ years of life sciences industry experience working with biological data. 3+ years of industry experience in molecular diagnostics, preferably cancer diagnostics. Expertise in data mining approaches within healthcare settings generating insight from routinely collected healthcare data. Basic knowledge of ML-Ops and processes for managing the versioning and deployment of machine learning models. Scientific understanding of cancer biology #LI-SM1    Salary Range:$143,000.00 - $228,000.00   The annual base salary shown is for this position located in US - CA - San Diego on a full-time basis and may differ by hiring location. In addition, this position is bonus eligible, and is eligible to receive company stock upon hire as well as annually. DescriptionDescriptionAs a ML engineer in the SIML HOUr team, you will work with large-language models and multi-modal generative models, following closely groundbreaking advancements in this domain, to adjust and apply them to internal use cases. One main mission of the role is building adapters on top of large models to enable specific use cases, having a direct impact on features across the Apple ecosystem. The work will involve translating high-level product goals into different levels of the stack. From defining the data needs, manipulating data, fine-tuning pre-trained models for the task, evaluating it across relevant metrics and power and performance, prototyping and delivering it for integration. The work will be multi-functional, collaborating with ML researchers, software engineers, product design, and other teams. Be expected to iterate quickly to deliver a high quality model, that is performant, reliable, tested extensively, and documented. Apart from model development, the role will also give the experience of scoping projects, estimating timelines, multi-functional planning and presenting your work to organization leadership. Your Profile    a bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, or related fields with an outstanding study record, and are currently enrolled in a master’s program   a solid understanding of machine learning and computer vision   a solid programming background in Python and hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow   high motivation, creativity, flexibility, and a structured and independent way of working   effective communication and presentation skills     Your ZEISS Recruiting Team:Franziska Gansloser

Machine Learning Scientist III, Marketing       Expedia is looking for an outstanding Machine Learning Scientist III who is interested in breaking new grounds to solve some of the most sophisticated computational problems in the marketing domain! The focus of this position will be in developing innovative algorithms to power various aspects of highly sophisticated global marketing campaigns.   We participate in multifaceted and driven auctions in travel for Metasearch sites, Paid Search, and Social Media. We are solving a range of fundamental problems with varying levels of complexity. If you have a passion for the craft of statistics, optimization, control, and machine learning, you will help unlock tangible growth for our business by exploiting these data sets!     What you’ll do:     Develop scalable algorithms for bidding, content optimization, segmentation, and capital allocation   Provide technical leadership, identify key business challenges and opportunities, and develop end-to-end software solutions using statistics, machine learning, optimization, and control methods   Innovate and add complexity where complexity is needed   Assess the validity of assumptions and hypotheses through experiments   Collaborate with partners to ensure that solutions meet business needs by generating valid and feasible inferences       Who you are:     PhD in Computer Science or related technical field; or equivalent related professional experience   Strong algorithm design and object-oriented programming skills in at least one of major programming languages like Java, C/C++, Python   A minimum of 3 years validated experience working with real data   Strong interpersonal skills, both written and oral communication          The total cash range for this position in Seattle is $137,500.00 to $192,500.00. Employees in this role have the potential to increase their pay up to $220,000.00, which is the top of the range, based on ongoing, demonstrated, and sustained performance in the role.  Starting pay for this role will vary based on multiple factors, including location, available budget, and an individual’s knowledge, skills, and experience. Deine Mission  Als Machine Learning Architect in unserem Team spielst Du eine entscheidende Rolle bei der Entwicklung und Implementierung von ML- und AI-Technologien. Du lebst dein Talent als ML Architekt:in voll aus, konstruierst massgeschneiderte zukunftsbereite End-to-End-Architekturen, gestaltest AI-Ökosysteme und implementierst Machine Learning Systeme.  Das erwartet dich   Innovationsgetrieben gestaltest, planst und implementierst du Data & (Gen)AI-Architekturen einschliesslich der dazugehörigen Roadmaps für unsere Kunden in allen Industrien, wo du mit Enterprise Architects und Senior Management bis hin zu C-Level auf Kundenseite zusammenarbeitest. Der jeweiligen Anforderung entsprechend berätst du Kunden in Bezug auf die jeweils optimale Analytics- und (Gen)AI-Plattformarchitektur und den effizienten Weg dorthin. Technisch versiert implementierst du mit einem agilen Team einzelne Teile der Architektur in Proof-of-Concepts. Du evaluierst neue und aufstrebende Technologien, um unsere ML- und KI-Fähigkeiten zu verbessern Generell stehst du unseren Kunden bei allen Fragen zum Thema (Gen)AI-Architekturen mit aufgeschlossener Haltung und kompetenter Beratung zur Seite. Zudem hast du einen starken Hintergrund in der Verwendung von Cloud-basierten Stacks für MLOps. Du beherrschst fliessend Englisch und sprichst sehr gut Deutsch. Wir nutzen das gesamte Spektrum digitaler Technologien, um den Alltag unserer Kunden zu vereinfachen. Und ihr Business in die Zukunft zu führen. Und wenn die unterschiedlichsten Talente, Stärken und Sichtweisen aufeinandertreffen, entsteht etwas Grossartiges: Ideen, die in der Welt etwas bewegen. Deshalb setzen wir bei Accenture auf Diversität und freie Entfaltung. Schaffe dir ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du aufgehst. Mit Aufgaben, die dir am Herzen liegen. Mit einem Workload, der zu dir passt. "Text" : "Machine Learning Data Scientist (80% - 100%)Evulpo AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:11 September 2023Pensum:80 – 100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZürichMachine Learning Data Scientist (80% - 100%)The mission
Are you a talented Machine Learning Data Scientist with a passion for understanding user behaviors and preferences? Do you find thrill in deciphering vast datasets, unearthing patterns, and translating them into actionable insights? We invite you to be a driving force in our team as a Machine Learning Data Scientist, driving insights from user data that will steer the evolution of our platform. This is not just a job; it's an opportunity to revolutionize the way education adapts to its users. Embrace the challenge and be the beacon that guides our educational transformation.
Responsibilities
The Machine Learning Data Scientist will be an integral part of our dynamic start-up team in the Ed-Tech industry. They will drive the development of AI-powered tools to analyze user behavioral and transactional data. The candidate will be at the forefront of creating and optimizing models that ensure innovative and effective learning experiences in line with the curriculum. 
Your responsibilities include: 
 
 Data Handling & Model Development: 
 
 Gather, preprocess, and analyze data to understand key patterns and trends.  
 Develop, train, and test machine learning models to improve content delivery, personalization, and user engagement.  
  
 Collaboration: 
 
 Work closely with the Product and Content team to understand specific user behavioral data and nuances of the curriculum.  
 Collaborate with the engineering team to integrate machine learning models into our platform.  
  
 Evaluation & Optimization: 
 
 Monitor the performance of machine learning models in real-world scenarios.  
 Continuously refine and optimize models based on feedback and changing requirements.  
  
 Research & Innovation: 
 
 Stay updated with the latest trends and breakthroughs in machine learning and Ed-Tech.  
 Propose and test new algorithms or techniques that can improve learning experiences.  
  
 Documentation: 
 
 Document processes, models, and results for transparency and reproducibility.  
 Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis to the product and content teams.  
  

Requirements
 
 Education: Master's degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.  
 Experience: Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in building and deploying machine learning models.  
 Technical Proficiency: Strong proficiency in Python and its machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow, Keras, or Scikit-learn.  
 Data Skills: Expertise in data preprocessing, feature engineering, and data visualization.  
 Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  
 Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.  

Nice-To-Haves
 
 Ed-Tech Experience: Prior experience in the Ed-Tech industry or a deep understanding of educational pedagogies and curriculum.  
 Big Data Technologies: Experience with big data technologies like Spark or Hadoop.  
 Deployment: Familiarity with deploying machine learning models in real-world, production environments, experience in cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus.  
 Soft Skills: Ability to work in a fast-paced start-up environment, flexibility to adapt, and a strong team player.  
 Multilingual: Proficiency in one or more European languages apart from English.  

Offer
 
 Join an EdTech pioneer that's reshaping the landscape of education.  
 Collaborative and inclusive environment that values innovation and diverse perspectives.  
 Opportunities for skill development and professional growth.  
 Competitive compensation package and comprehensive benefits.  
 Become part of a mission-driven team working towards a brighter future.  
 
If you're passionate about harnessing the power of data to revolutionize the field of education, we encourage you to apply. Share your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and your enthusiasm for our mission. Join us in constructing a data-driven future of learning. Auf diese Stelle bewerben 
About usAlways. Everywhere. At the push of a button.  evulpo is a learning platform for all students aged 9-19 and already offers explanatory videos, summaries and practice units for English, Maths, and Science topics in other European countries. The team of this young startup is committed to changing the world of international education for the long term: All students - regardless of background - should not only have the same right but also the same access to education.       Why do we want that? Everyone has the right to education", says the 26th article of human rights. Well said... the problem is that while everyone has the same right to education, not everyone has the same access to education. Some have good teachers. Others don't. Some have older siblings. Others don't. Some have money for tutoring. Others don't. Auf diese Stelle bewerben

Would you like to work in the fast-paced, competitive, customer-focused and data-rich world of online travel?    Our Machine Learning team is growing! We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist III to use Machine Learning to help optimize hundreds of millions of dollars of Marketing spend and to help increase customer long-term value through relevant and engaging interactions. This exciting opportunity would allow you to solve a broad range of high-impact, complex problems using some of the latest Data Science techniques.    What you’ll do:    This role will be particularly focused on optimising our bidding strategy within Acquisition channels.   This is a very complex & high impact modelling problem that involves dealing with data scarcity, rapidly changing trends, auction dynamic changes etc   Working closely with our Bidding Operations and Meta teams, you will support our bidding strategy for some of our partners, such as Trivago or Google. This will entail implementing and evaluating new model variants offline & online to continuously improve the overall efficiency of our bidding process.      Who you are:    3+ years demonstrated experience in machine learning, building datasets, selecting and engineering features, building and optimising algorithms   Great programming practices, able to write readable, performant code   Significant experience in at least one major machine learning programming language (Python, Scala…) and familiar with others.   Significant experience with statistics/machine learning packages such as Spark MLlib, Python (scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, scipy, Matplotlib), Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch etc.   Great data manipulation skills required including cleaning and managing data   Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn new things, techniques and technologies      Why join us:    Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better - that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares. Dann werde Teil unseres Teams und begleite von der Idee bis zur realisierten Lösung.Das erwartet dichÜbernahme von Verantwortung für Datenprojekte sowie die Weiterentwicklung der Wertschöpfung aus Daten unserer Kunden und außerdem:

Analytische Fähigkeiten, Gestaltungswillen und Umsetzungsstärke. 
Neugierde, Motivation sowie Unternehmergeist, um eigenständig Themen voranzutreiben. 
 Wir bieten dir & Über uns... neue, spannende Herausforderungen in einem kreativen, teamorientierten Umfeld. Verwirkliche mit uns deine Big Five for Life** in einer Kultur, die geprägt ist von Vertrauen, Authentizität und Zusammenhalt.   Benefits, über die du dich bald freuen kannst:
 
Verwirklichung eigener Ideen sowie unternehmerischer Freiraum

La Direction Energie électrique exploite les infrastructures de production hydrauliques et thermiques, développe des installations de production à partir d’énergies renouvelables et assure un approvisionnement en électricité aux meilleures conditions. Afin de compléter notre équipe, nous sommes à la recherche de notre futur·e : Machine Learning Engineer / Trader (H/F) 80-100% Mission :  Développer des algorithmes et modèles prédictifs s’intégrant dans l’activités de gestion de portefeuilles (times series, machine learning, data engineering, …) Optimiser financièrement, définir et réaliser des stratégies de couverture des portefeuilles de production et de consommation sur les marchés de l’électricité Valoriser les ouvrages de production et saisir les opportunités avec toutes les options de valorisation de la flexibilité Concevoir des outils d’étude statistiques et pouvoir présenter les résultats de manière efficace  Profil :  Formation technique supérieure (EPF/HES/UNI), idéalement dans le domaine de la data science Expérience dans le « machine learning », idéalement dans les time series Connaissance de l’écosystème Linux, Docker et GIT Maîtrise d’un ou plusieurs langages de programmation, particulièrement pour Python (Pandas) et SQL Compétences avancées en mathématiques, statistiques, probabilités et connaissances des systèmes stochastiques Idéalement, connaissances du marché de l’énergie, des installations hydrauliques et des prévisions météorologiques. Français minimum C1, avec de bonnes connaissances de l'allemand ou de l'anglais Engagé, flexible avec un intérêt pour le marché de l’énergie (possibilité de travailler jusqu'à 20% en télétravail) Service de piquet sur appel 24/24 depuis votre domicile (toutes les 6 semaines)  Ce que nous vous offrons :  Un environnement évolutif et favorable à l’équilibre entre la vie professionnelle et privée. Les prestations sociales d’une entreprise moderne, une équité de traitement, des possibilités de développement professionnel. "Text" : "PhD in Machine Learning for 3D Computer VisionETH get hiredBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:20 August 2024Pensum:100%Arbeitsort:ZürichPhD in Machine Learning for 3D Computer VisionPhD in Machine Learning for 3D Computer Vision 100%, Zurich, fixed-term The Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing Group at ETH (Prof. Konrad Schindler) is seeking applications for a doctoral candidate. Our research revolves around computer vision, remote sensing and visual AI. Job description We are offering a fully-funded position for a motivated and talented individual to join our research team as a doctoral student and develop generative visual AI models for 3D data. This research opportunity is part of a collaborative project with our partners at Google Research, focusing on developing advanced visual AI models for multiview and 3D-consistent image generation. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on pioneering research in AI, contributing to both academic advancements and industry-leading innovations. The position is available from October 2024 onwards. Profile  MSc degree in computer science, engineering, or a related subject Proficiency in programming, preferably in Python and/or Jax Strong analytical, mathematical and algorithmic capabilities Experience with deep learning technology and computer vision Fluent communication in English (both written and spoken) Motivation, curiosity and willingness to learn  Workplace Workplace We offer  An opportunity to further your scientific career at a leading academic institution Excellent working conditions A chance to work in a stimulating environment as part of a multi-cultural research team Exposure to both academia and the commercial tech sector High quality of Life in one of the World’s most livable cities  We value diversity Curious? So are we. If you are interested in joining our team, please submit your complete application online through the ETH job portal:  motivation letter curriculum vitae academic transcripts contact details of at least two academic referees  The deadline for applications is the 31st of October 2024. Selection will start immediately, so early submissions are encouraged. Please note that we exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered. Further information about Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing can be found on our website. Questions regarding the position should be directed to Prof. Konrad Schindler by email E-Mail schreiben (no applications). About ETH Zürich Curious? So are we. Analytische Fähigkeiten, Gestaltungswillen und Umsetzungsstärke.

"Text" : "Machine Learning Engineer (TE-CRG-GLO-2024-138-GRAE)CERN European Organization for Nuclear ResearchBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:07 August 2024Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:GenfMachine Learning Engineer (TE-CRG-GLO-2024-138-GRAE)    Job Description   You are a Data Scientist interested in deploying your skills in machine learning algorithms and in particular in: - Machine learning experiments using programming languages like Python along with libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn; - Writing and implementing SOTA machine learning algorithms; - Developing federated learning software and algorithms. - Implementing differential privacy and homomorphic encryption; - Ensuring efficient data flow between databases and backend systems to support machine learning initiatives, using tools like Apache Spark; - Analyzing data to identify new use cases and derive actionable insights, employing statistical analysis, visualization for exploratory data analysis (EDA); - Developing solutions for supply chain analysis, risks prediction and strategy management. More information here: https://cafein.web.cern.ch   Who we are looking for   Skills and/or knowledge   Expert knowledge of Python programming language, common deep learning frameworks, machine learning algorithms, federated learning tools and algorithms; Familiarity with GNNs, risks and anomaly detection algorithms; Knowledge of supply chain analysis and tools would be an advantage; Fluent in English, the ability to work in French would be an advantage.   Eligibility criteria:   You are a national of a CERN Member or Associate Member State.   By the application deadline,  you have a maximum of two years of professional experience since graduation in IT, Data Science, Mathematics (or a related field)  and your highest educational qualification is either a Bachelor's or Master's degree. You have never had a CERN fellow or graduate contract before. Applicants without University degree are not eligible. Applicants with a PhD are not eligible.      Additional Information   Job closing date: 29 August 2024 at 23h59 CEST  Job reference: TE-CRG-GLO-2024-138-GRAE Contract duration: 24 months, with a possible extension up to 36 months maximum. Target start date: 01-October-2024    What we offer   A monthly stipend ranging between 5134  and 5647  Swiss Francs (net of tax). Coverage by CERN's comprehensive health scheme (for yourself, your spouse and children), and membership of the CERN Pension Fund. Depending on your individual circumstances: installation grant; family, child and infant allowances; payment of travel expenses at the beginning and end of contract.  30 days of paid leave per year. On-the-job and formal training at CERN as well as in-house language courses for English and/or French.   About us  At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern.     Diversity has been an integral part of CERN's mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization. Employing a diverse workforce is central to our success.

"ID" : "650b2a94-5089-4a90-b931-18dcf3f28be6"
"Job Title" : "Machine Learning Engineer, SIML"
"Company" : "Apple Switzerland AG"
"Veröffentlicht" : "06 Januar 2024"
"Pensum" : "100%"
"Vertrag" : "Festanstellung"
