Dan is de rol van Managing Consultant bij HSO iets voor jou!Wat ga je doen?Als Managing Consultant speel jij een cruciale rol! Je combineert de rol van Team Lead met die van Lead Consultant/Solution Architect en/of Project- en Programmamanager. Je bent lid van het MT en P&L verantwoordelijk. Je gaat aan de slag met complexe ERP implementaties, waarbij je gebruik maakt van de Microsoft Technologie. Je bent betrokken vanaf de salesfase, voert klantcontact op directieniveau, stuurt projectteams aan, brengt structuur aan en maakt gebruik van HSO's implementatiemethodologie (Excellerate). Je daagt het team om in de huid van de klant te kruipen en voorstellend te zijn tijdens de Solution Modeling fase; Je maakt gebruik van best practices. Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in de de Manufacturing Industry; Daarnaast werk je ook nauw samen met de IMU (Industry Market Unit) om de propositie van het team te versterken; Ook zorg je ervoor dat de Performance Management cyclus tijdig goed wordt uitgevoerd. De mix van klantvraag, onze aanpak en jouw ervaring leidt tot een plan dat waarde oplevert voor de klant en voor HSO. Dit is het resultaat waar jij voor gaat! Over het teamJe bent onderdeel van de Service Line Unified Operations, een onderdeel van HSO Nederland. Unified Operations is een geoliede projectservices organisatie met een uitstekende reputatie op het gebied van ERP. Samen met de andere Servicelines binnen HSO kunnen we de complete Microsoft Stack aanbieden (Modern Workplace, Analytics, CE, Azure Integrations, e.d.). Het totale team van onze Service Line bestaat momenteel uit ruim 100 professionals, onder leiding van de Service Line Director Arie Martin van den Akker. Wil jij je kennis van logistieke processen inzetten op uitdagende projecten? En werk je graag in wisselende projectteams? Dan zoeken we jou!Introductie van de rol Als Consultant Microsoft Dynamics 365 Logistiek zet je jouw kennis van Supply Chain Management processen en van technologie in, om klanten verder te brengen. Je werkt in wisselende projectteams aan de realisatie en implementatie van Microsoft Dynamics 365 voor o.a. groothandel, Retail en technische dienstverlening en vertaalt de vraagstukken van onze klanten naar concrete oplossingen.Betrouwbaar, resultaatgericht en voorspelbaar. Dat willen we zijn voor onze klanten en deze eigenschappen zoeken we ook in nieuwe medewerkers. HSO bestaat uit een hechte club mensen met een no-nonsense mentaliteit, die uitstekend weten waarover ze het hebben en zich echt verdiepen in de klant en doen wat ze zeggen. Medewerkers met oog voor elkaar, die elkaar ook willen helpen.Wat ga je doen? Je fungeert als volwaardig sparringpartner voor collega’s en klanten;Je werkt in wisselende projectteams aan de implementatie van de financiële modules;Je functioneert als adviseur bij klanten op niveau van directie en management en vertaalt de vraagstukken van onze klanten naar concrete oplossingen en begeleidt het complete implementatietraject;Je hebt een leidende rol in de uitvoering van simulaties met kerngebruikers en je houdt je ook bezig met het verzamelen en delen van branche-/productkennis met andere collega’s;Je analyseert en optimaliseert huidige financiële bedrijfsprocessen en zorgt samen met de klant en collega Consultants voor de inrichting van het systeem.Over het teamJe bent onderdeel van de Service Line Unified Operations, een onderdeel van HSO Nederland. Unified Operations is een geoliede projectservices organisatie met een uitstekende reputatie op het gebied van ERP. Samen met de andere Servicelines binnen HSO kunnen we de complete Microsoft Stack aanbieden (Modern Workplace, Analytics, CE, Azure Integrations, e.d.). Het totale team van onze Service Line bestaat momenteel uit ruim 100 professionals, onder leiding van de Service Line Director Arie Martin van den Akker. Als Technical Architect ben je eindverantwoordelijk voor de technische architectuur op de korte en lange termijn in projecten en sales trajecten. Je beschrijft en ontwikkelt de technische architectuur inclusief de integraties die daarbij komen kijken. Naast het ontwerpen van migratiescenario’s, onderhoud je ook contact met de technische en inhoudelijke stakeholders bij de klant en HSO. Het maken en uitdragen van technische best practices richting klanten en (interne) collega’s. Als Technical Architect ben je de motivator voor de technische collega’s van het klantteam. Als digital leader naar de klant ben je in staat om breder te kijken dan de oplossing die wij leveren maar zie je deze in het totale end-to-end klantproces. Als Technical Architect ben je verantwoordelijk voor het technische deel van de oplossing. Daarnaast: Je bent betrokken in de designfase en bepaalt welke technologieën kunnen worden gebruikt in welke scenario's. Je draagt bij aan de technische best practices van HSO en draagt deze ook uit naar de klant en het team. Je fungeert als technische vraagbaak voor de technische en functionele consultants. Daarnaast houd je je bezig met integraties met andere (third-party) applicaties, je denkt mee over integration patterns. Je zorgt ervoor dat alles in source control terecht komt en dat er automatisch uitgerold wordt d,m,v, Azure DevOps pipelines. Samen met de Product Owner stel je een roadmap op voor technische verbeteringen. Wat vertellen onze huidige technische architecten over deze rol?“Het werk als technische architect is heel erg uitdagend en gevarieerd. Je werkt samen met hele leuke collega’s op projecten. Op het project ben je verantwoordelijk voor de algehele kwaliteit en samenhang van het IT-landschap. Primair binnen de kaders van het project. Echter doordat je implementatie altijd samenhangt met andere systemen ben je ook veel bezig met het landschap buiten het Microsoft project. Je bepaalt samen met de klant waar je naartoe gaat over de jaren heen en ziet jouw plannen dan werkelijkheid worden. Als je het leuk vindt is er ook altijd ruimte om op de inhoud in te gaan. Als je dat doet ben je vooral bezig met de complexe onderdelen van het project en dat is erg leuk en uitdagend.Naast de projecten houd je je bezig met de best practices van HSO. Je krijgt daardoor altijd de nieuwe ontwikkelingen mee en krijgt de kans om daar wat mee te doen.” Als Consultant Customer Engagement D365 vertaal je de vraagstukken van de klant naar de beste oplossing. Wil je voorop lopen met innovatie en technologie? Dan is HSO CRM Solutions op zoek naar jou! Jij helpt met jouw kennis en persoonlijkheid het verschil bij onze klanten en helpt HSO groeien.Jouw uitdagingen: Jij lost complexe business vraagstukken op door de juiste vertaling en inrichting te maken naar technologie; Sterker nog: met dynamics 365 overtref je de verwachtingen van de klant; Samen met het projectteam zorg je voor een vlekkeloze implementatie; Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor de klant en de verbindende schakel tussen betrokken teams en partijen. Als Solution Architect ben jij gedurende de klantreis het inhoudelijke geweten en help je organisaties hun doelstellingen te realiseren. Jij lost complexe business vraagstukken op door de juiste vertaling en inrichting te maken naar technologie. Sterker nog: met Dynamics 365 overtref je de verwachtingen van de klant. Jij bent functioneel verantwoordelijk voor de implementatie van de integrale CE-oplossing. Ben je een ervaren Senior Consultant of Solution Architect en wil je vooroplopen met innovatie en technologie? Dan is HSO CRM Solutions op zoek naar jou!Jij stelt bij jouw klanten de roadmap op voor nieuwe projecten en zorgt dat er een solide, consistente en toekomstbestendige oplossing wordt ontworpen. Jij bent een sparringpartner voor het senior management en jij fungeert als spin in het web tussen klant, jouw technische en functionele collega’s en de projectmanagers. Daarnaast geef jij input voor de doorontwikkeling van branche oplossingen van HSO. Vaak ben jij ook betrokken en ook verantwoordelijk voor de realisatie van de oplossing. Jij vindt het daarom fijn om zelf ook in de klei te staan, om zorg te dragen dat jouw oplossingen worden gerealiseerd, de kwaliteit van de oplossing hoog is en de klanttevredenheid toe neemt. Jij hebt nauw contact met andere Solution Architecten, Lead Consultants, Projectmanagers en Accountmanagers om up-sell en cross-sell te spotten en proactief de klant en jouw (internationale) collega’s te verrassen met nieuwe kennis en branche inzichten.Jij bentEen ontwerper! Jij bent goed in staat om het bedachte en ontworpen applicatie landschap ook overtuigend te presenteren aan de klant (veelal IT-director, afdelingshoofden, key users architect, projectmanager).Een strateeg! Je bent een gedreven professional met een klantgerichte en stressbestendige instelling! Jij bent analytisch, creatief en communicatief sterk. Daarnaast geef je graag feedback en sta je altijd klaar voor jouw team.Een visionair! Jij bent van mening dat stilstand achteruitgang is en bent daarom altijd op zoek naar mogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten. De kennis die jij hebt opgedaan deel je graag met je collega’s. Delen is voor jou vermenigvuldigen. As a Managed Services Dynamics CE Senior Technical Consultant experience you can expect to… Design, develop, and deploy custom solutions within Dynamics 365 CE, including custom entities, forms, views, workflows, plugins, and web resources Implement advanced customizations using C#, JavaScript, and other relevant technologies to extend Dynamics 365 CE capabilities Develop and maintain integrations between Dynamics 365 CE and other systems using custom code and middleware solutions Design and implement automated workflows and business processes using Power Automate to enhance operational efficiency and streamline tasks Create and manage Power BI reports and dashboards, integrating them with Dynamics 365 CE to provide meaningful insights and data visualizations Develop complex queries, data models, and reports to support data-driven decision-making and business intelligence Create comprehensive documentation for custom solutions, integrations, and Power BI reports Provide technical training and support to internal teams and end-users on Dynamics 365 CE, Power Automate, and Power BI You're great at... Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and design technical solutions that align with business needs and technical specifications Developing and documenting technical specifications, including architecture diagrams and integration designs Conducting unit testing, integration testing, and performance testing of custom solutions and integrations to ensure high quality and reliability Troubleshooting and resolving issues related to custom code, integrations, and reporting Staying current with the latest advancements in Dynamics 365 CE, Power Automate, and Power BI. Recommending and implementing best practices to improve development processes, enhance system performance, and ensure the effective use of Dynamics 365 CE and related technologies As a Lead Consultant with Dynamics 365 Production experience you can expect to… Engage in value-adding business and application consultancy that manage and streamline manufacturing processes for clients Lead D365 Production and/or Supply Chain implementations from analysis phase and onward with little supervision from the Functional Solution Architect in a highly visible, client facing role Implement and configure D365 Production functionalities, including: production planning, production scheduling, bill of materials (BOM), production orders, shop floor control, inventory management, quality management, cost management, and reporting and analytics Guide teams on project processes, deliverables and contribute to the proposal development, client training and internal capability building, help detail the project scope Carry out prototyping plans, design, configuration, testing, procedure documentation and deployment, and communicate with your team Travel to client-site when necessary You’re great at… Developing strong functional, analytical, presentation, documentation, training and interpersonal skills Building relationships with clients and partners Prioritizing tasks and communicating commitments Working in a highly collaborative team environment Solving complex problems with creative solutions Learning new concepts quickly and thoroughly Promoting the mission and Shared Values of our company About HSOHSO Success and AmbitionHSO are a leading Microsoft Dynamics Gold partner who were founded in 1987 specializing in sectors such as Retail, Rental, Manufacturing, Professional Services and Local Government. With a head count of over 280 employees in the UK, winning multiple awards such as 2020 Microsoft Partner of the Year, Best Tech company 2021 and Top 3 Large Companies to work for 2021 our reputation in the Dynamics Market is higher than ever.Prioritizing customer satisfaction, our expertise and pragmatic approach to each customer’s business needs enable us to provide a 100% reference-able solution, supported by award winning 24-hour support. Our recruitment moto has always been – ‘We don’t want good people to just join us, we want them to stay with us’. Ensuring our employees are challenged, supported and engaged in our wider family is key to our continued success – we have a designated Learning and Development Team who are continuously offering the best training on the market, combined with an Engagement Team who are creative in ways we can have social activities virtually. From online chess tournaments to coffee mornings, to Netflix and book clubs, virtual singing classes, online yoga – the list is endless! About HSOHSO are a leading Microsoft Dynamics Gold partner who were founded in 1987 specialising in sectors such as Retail, Rental, Manufacturing, Professional Services and Local Government. With a head count of over 280 employees in the UK, winning multiple awards such as 2020 Microsoft Partner of the Year, Best Tech company 2021 and Top 3 Large Companies to work for 2021 our reputation in the Dynamics Market is higher than ever. Prioritizing customer satisfaction, our expertise and pragmatic approach to each customer’s business needs enable us to provide a 100% reference-able solution, supported by award winning 24-hour support. To work in all areas of project lifecycle from RFP and Tender through to Implementation and support, including providing project management support; with responsibility for solution design, delivery, deployment and post go-live support.Reporting to CRM Team LeaderKey Responsibilities:· To provide senior functional consultancy across a diverse range of Dynamics CRM projects giving input to the whole implementation life cycle· Liaise with clients to analyses business processes, perform fit gap analysis, develop design specifications, clarify customer requirements and determine the scope of required solution· Be the main point of contact for the development team from initial briefing through to acceptance of the solution into system testing· Lead and participate in internal and customer facing testing of the completed solution· Train end-users on the functionality and usage of Dynamics 365 applications· Support & collaborate with QA team to automate D365 Testing· Working with Project managers to ensure activities are kept within budget/time constraints and delivered to agreed quality guidelines· Manage customer expectations regarding the solution whilst ensuring the maximum use is being made of the software· To provide 2nd level assistance to the support team in the evaluation and resolution of Dynamics CRM issues of a functional nature· To work closely with the CRM Team Leader, Solution Lead, Project Managers and the Development Team To work closely with HSO Dynamics CRM· Customers, to build relationships and always provide a professional and quality service · Knowledge base for end users and team members on implementations. HSO ist ein Transformationspartner mit fundiertem Branchenwissen und globaler Präsenz. Wir nutzen das gesamte Potenzial der Microsoft Cloud, um die Arbeitswelt unserer Kunden zu transformieren und die Unternehmensleistung zu optimieren. Mit weltweit +2500 Mitarbeiter:innen unterstützen wir Unternehmen bei der Modernisierung von Geschäftsabläufen. HSO ist seit über 20 Jahren Mitglied im Microsoft Inner Circle – eine exklusive Gemeinschaft, zu der weltweit nur das Top 1% aller Microsoft-Partner gehört. Zahlreiche Partner of the Year Awards von Microsoft sind der Beweis für unsere ausgezeichnete Microsoft- und Branchen-Expertise. Join the journey!Für die Branche Manufacturing suchen wir ab sofort einen Industry Director (m/w/d), der die branchenspezifischen Anforderungen, Herausforderungen, Potenziale und Risiken kennt. Als Repräsentant der Branche verknüpfst du deine Branchenexpertise mit den neuesten IT-Trends und erarbeitest gemeinsam mit unserem Team aus Expert:innen und dem Kunden eine IT-Roadmap, mit welcher dieser am Markt flexibel und erfolgreich agieren kann.Deine Aufgaben im Detail: Value Proposition: Abgestimmt auf die Trends in der Manufacturing Branche definierst du Value Propositiones auf Basis unseres Lösungsportfolios und erkennst neue Möglichkeiten, um unseren Kunden einen zusätzlichen Nutzen zu bieten. Sales: Mit deinem Knowhow aus der Industrie begeisterst du unsere Kunden, insbesondere das C-Level, mit den neuesten Business- und IT Trends und gestaltest die Sales Strategie mit. Zusammenarbeit: Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen der Strategie des Kunden und dem Business Case/Projekt inkl. Sales, Lösungsarchitekten und dem Projektmanagement, um die technische Expertise mit dem Industrie-Knowhow anzureichern und arbeitest darüber hinaus auch mit den Microsoft Account Teams zusammen. Strategische Projektziele: Im Rahmen der Diagnose und Analyse erbringst du Beratungsdienstleistungen für den Kunden, analysierst Geschäftsmodelle, Prozesse sowie Anforderungen und leitest daraus nachhaltige Projektziele sowie den Input zur Erstellung der IT-Roadmap und dem Projektmanagementplan ab. Delivery: Während des Programms/Projekts hast du die Projektziele im Blick, gibst die Richtung vor und steuerst Änderungen; Qualitätssicherung ist hier deine Priorität. Marketing: Um die HSO-Marke zu stärken, erarbeitest du Initiativen mit dem Marketing wie die Organisation von Kundenevents oder die Content-Erstellung industrie-spezifische Whitepaper, eBooks, Success Stories/Referenzen etc. in welchen die aktuellen Industrie-Trends identifiziert sowie deren Auswirkungen beschrieben werden. Heute beschäftigen wir ca. 2.500 Mitarbeiter weltweit an verschiedenen Standorten in Europa, Nordamerika und Asien. Für die HSO Deutschland suchen wir einen erfahrenen Senior DevOps Engineer, der sich schnell weiterentwickeln und eine Karriere bei uns machen möchte. Dieses Team ist verantwortlich für: Azure Landing Zone: Entwurf und Implementierung der Azure Landing Zone unter Einsatz von Infrastructure as Code-Lösungen (IaC) zur Automatisierung der Bereitstellung Azure Workloads: Entwicklung von Azure Workloads und der Bereitstellung über ARM-Templates Einrichtung von Build- und Release-Pipelines (CI/CD) unter Verwendung von Azure DevOps Verlagerung von Legacy-Workloads (Informationstechnologie) auf moderne Cloud-Lösungen (Azure, Microsoft 365) Beratung von Cloud-Foundation-Szenarien und Implementierung von EntraID-Tenants. Beratung unserer Kunden für deren Tenant-Strategie und Durchführung von Tenant-Migranten Sicherstellung einer angemessenen Azure-DevOps-Struktur in Projekten für die HSO Bereitstellung und Optimierung von automatisierten Funktionen einschließlich Überwachung, Patching, Backup, Wiederherstellung, Hochverfügbarkeit, Benutzerverwaltung, Zugriffskontrolle und Audit-Protokollierung. HSO ist einer der führenden Microsoft Partner und gehört zum Microsoft Inner Circle, in dem sich die besten 1 % aller Microsoft-Partner weltweit befinden. Wir sind in Europa, Nordamerika, Asien und Australien vertreten und beraten mit mehr als 2.500 Mitarbeiter:innen namhafte Kunden bei komplexen IT-Projekten auf der ganzen Welt. Unser Ziel ist es, die Strategie unserer Kunden mit der Microsoft Cloud Technologie in Einklang zu bringen, um einen echten Mehrwert zu generieren. Hierfür suchen wir dich - einen erfahrenen Enterprise Architekten (m/w/d) - mit umfassender technischer Expertise für unser Team in Deutschland. In dieser zentralen Rolle fungierst du als wichtige Schnittstelle zwischen technischen und funktionalen Aspekten von groß angelegten Transformationsprojekten auf Basis von Microsoft Cloud- und Drittanbieterlösungen. Pre-Sales: Du unterstützt unser Sales- und Pre Sales-Team bei der Definition der HSO Value Propositions. Du zeigst unseren Kunden auf, welchen „Mehrwert“ HSO mit der Microsoft Cloud für ausgewählte Industrien liefern kann. Du begleitest unsere Industry-Leads, Projektmanager und „Blackbelts“ in Sales-Projekten. Technology Roadmap: Du nutzt dein vielfältiges Wissen über Microsoft-Lösungen wie Azure, Dynamics 365 F&O, CE, Power Platform, Data, AI usw., um integrierte, skalierbare Lösungen für unsere Kunden aufzuzeigen und Projekte zu definieren. Strategische Projektplanung: Auf Basis der Geschäftsziele und Anforderungen unserer Kunden triffst du technologische Entscheidungen, entwickelst umfassende Systemarchitekturen und leitest daraus Arbeitspakete zur Planung und Steuerung des Projektes ab. Technische Umsetzung: In der Design- und Implementierungsphase unterstützt du das Projektteam bei der technischen Umsetzung und entwickelst Strategien, um den Projekterfolg sicherzustellen. Stakeholder Engagement: Du bist Teil der Project-Governance für „Enterprise“- und „Platform-Projekte“. Zusammen mit den Projektmanagern pflegst du enge Beziehungen zu internen und externen Stakeholdern, einschließlich C-Level Executives und den technischen Projekt-Teams. Weiterbildung: Du hältst dich zu neuen Trends und Lösungen, die über das Microsoft-Ökosystem oder andere zugehörige Lösungen von Drittanbietern verfügbar werden, auf dem Laufenden. Beispiele sind Open AI, Machine Learning, CoPilot und wie diese über die D365-Landschaft genutzt werden können. HSO ist ein Transformationspartner mit fundiertem Branchenwissen und globaler Präsenz. Wir nutzen das gesamte Potenzial der Microsoft Cloud, um die Arbeitswelt unserer Kunden zu transformieren und die Unternehmensleistung zu optimieren. Mit weltweit +2500 Mitarbeitern unterstützen wir Unternehmen bei der Modernisierung von Geschäftsabläufen. HSO ist seit über 20 Jahren Mitglied im Microsoft Inner Circle – eine exklusive Gemeinschaft, zu der weltweit nur das Top 1% aller Microsoft-Partner gehört. Zahlreiche Partner of the Year Awards von Microsoft sind der Beweis für unsere ausgezeichnete Microsoft- und Branchen-Expertise. Join the journey!WAS DICH ERWARTET: Ausgangsbasis: Die HSO ist führender Microsoft Partner bei der Implementierung von Microsoft Dynamics 365 bei produzierenden Unternehmen. Wir betreuen diese Kunden in allen End to End Prozessen und bedienen uns dabei der gesamten Microsoft Dynamics 365 Plattform. Beratung und Lösungsfindung: Als Consultant mit Schwerpunkt Manufacturing ist die Hauptaufgabe, produzierende Unternehmen dabei zu unterstützen, die richtigen IT-Lösungen für ihre spezifischen Geschäftsanforderungen zu finden. Du wirst eng mit den Kunden zusammenarbeiten, um ihre Geschäftsprozesse zu verstehen und zu analysieren. Auf Grundlage dieser Informationen entwickelst du gemeinsam mit einem Lead/Senior Consultant maßgeschneiderte Lösungen und Konzepte, die auf Microsoft Dynamics 365 basieren. Implementierung: Nachdem ihr die passende Lösung für euren Workstream in Abstimmung mit dem Solution Architecten und dem Project-Team konzipiert habt, bist du für die Implementierung und Integration von Microsoft Dynamics 365 in die bestehende IT-Infrastruktur des Kunden im Rahmen deines Bereiches verantwortlich. Dies beinhaltet die Konfiguration der Software, das Datenmanagement und die Anpassung von Prozessen, um sicherzustellen, dass die Lösung reibungslos funktioniert. Du arbeitest dabei oft im Team und sorgst dafür, dass alle technischen Komponenten effizient zusammenarbeiten. Schulung und Support: Ein entscheidender Aspekt deiner Arbeit besteht darin, Endbenutzer und Mitarbeiter deines Kunden in der Nutzung von Microsoft Dynamics 365 zu schulen. Du erstellst Schulungspläne und -materialien, führst Schulungen durch und stehst den Nutzern bei Fragen oder Problemen zur Seite. Dein Ziel ist es, sicherzustellen, dass die Mitarbeiter die Software effektiv nutzen und von ihren Funktionen profitieren. Geschäftsprozessoptimierung: Gemeinsam mit deinem Kunden optimiert, digitalisiert und automatisiert ihr die bestehenden Geschäftsprozesse. Ihr erarbeitet und dokumentiert integrierte Lösungen mit hohem Kundennutzen. Dabei bringst du unsere und deine Erfahrungen nach dem Best-Practice-Ansatz ein. Technisches Know-how: Durch sukzessive Weiterentwicklung deines Wissens auf dem neuesten Stand der Entwicklungen in Microsoft Dynamics 365 und insbesondere im Rahmen der Abwicklung von produzierenden Unternehmen, baust Du dein Wissen und deine Fähigkeit aus, technisches Wissen in geschäftliche Lösungen umzusetzen. Tools und Methoden@HSO: Du wendest dabei unsere ausgezeichnete Projektmethodik HSO Excellerate™ in klassischer oder agiler Ausprägung an und nutzt dabei die modernsten Tools aus Microsoft Dynamics 365 Portfolio intelligenter Geschäftsanwendungen. HSO is expanding and we are looking for an experienced Solution Architect to join our D365 Finance & Operations team.The D365 F&O Solution Architect is a senior role providing solution leadership through consulting engagements. As an Solution Architect, you will be responsible for providing strategic advice and subject matter expertise in the relevant industry. You will work closely with clients to develop high-level and detailed designs for Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O) implementations. Additionally, you will act as the design authority and provide oversight during project delivery.Key Responsibilities: Develop solutions that meet client requirements using best-of-breed technologies and methodologies. Translate business requirements into technology requirements for inclusion in contracts and statements of work (SOW). Provide advice, high-level and detailed designs during project delivery engagements. Ensure quality oversight at various stages of the project lifecycle. Create solution proposals and cost models for projects, including software, support/maintenance, and services. Produce responses to request for proposals (RFPs). Act as the design authority and technical escalation point for projects. Collaborate with the project delivery team to develop customer account plans and roadmaps. Manage projects through the entire project lifecycle, ensuring high customer satisfaction. About HSO:HSO is a leading global Microsoft solution integrator that specializes in providing innovative solutions and services based on Microsoft Dynamics 365. We are currently seeking a highly motivated and hands on Senior Project Manager in Sydney to join our team and lead digital transformation projects using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations.Responsibilities: Manage end-to-end project delivery, including project planning, execution, and project team management Work closely with our customers and the HSO consulting team to ensure business requirements are met and delivered in a timely manner Ensure project success in terms of scope, schedule, profitability, quality, and customer satisfaction Provide leadership and guidance to project teams, ensuring effective communication and coordination Manage project resources, risks, and contracts Participate in steering committee and strategy meetings Run daily stand ups as necessary Reporting, invoicing, budgetary control and governance Utilize HSO's proven project methodology to successfully deliver projects About HSOHSO Success and AmbitionHSO are a leading Microsoft Dynamics Gold partner who were founded in 1987 specializing in sectors such as Retail, Rental, Manufacturing, Professional Services and Local Government. With a head count of over 280 employees in the UK, winning multiple awards such as 2020 Microsoft Partner of the Year, Best Tech company 2021 and Top 3 Large Companies to work for 2021 our reputation in the Dynamics Market is higher than ever.Prioritizing customer satisfaction, our expertise and pragmatic approach to each customer’s business needs enable us to provide a 100% reference-able solution, supported by award winning 24-hour support. Our recruitment moto has always been – ‘We don’t want good people to just join us, we want them to stay with us’. Ensuring our employees are challenged, supported and engaged in our wider family is key to our continued success – we have a designated Learning and Development Team who are continuously offering the best training on the market, combined with an Engagement Team who are creative in ways we can have social activities virtually. From online chess tournaments to coffee mornings, to Netflix and book clubs, virtual singing classes, online yoga – the list is endless! Die Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeiter in neuen Rollen und der Erwerb neuer Fähigkeiten ist der Weg, wie wir jedem eine Karriereentwicklung ermöglichen.Wir suchen einen hochmotivierten und erfahrenen Solution Architect für Dynamics 365 Retail, der unser dynamisches Team verstärkt und eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Gestaltung innovativer Lösungen für unsere Kunden einnimmt. "Text" : "(Senior) Electrical Engineer - R&D 80-100% (f/m/d)Hitachi Energy AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:23 August 2024Pensum:80 – 100%Arbeitsort:Aargau(Senior) Electrical Engineer - R&D 80-100% (f/m/d) 
  Product Evaluation and Qualification, R&D BiMOS   At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation   In our „Product evaluation and qualification“ team at Hitachi Energy Semiconductors in Lenzburg, we make sure to get to the bottom of things and deliver faultless robust semiconductor chips and power modules through a rigorous qualification process. Our products are delivered to a wide range of customers worldwide for different industrial applications as well as renewable energy, traction and eMobility. In addition to writing and reviewing test reports, you communicate key findings to project stakeholders   You are engaged in general activities in the testing laboratory to ensure continuous improvement of our activities to guarantee customer satisfaction   Ensure compliance to safety rules, environmental protection, following the cleanliness and order in the test laboratories is a core consideration in your every action       Your background   Technical diploma and/or bachelor’s degree with work experience in electrical engineering or related field with focus on semiconductor devices or power electronics   Proven work experience in power electronics, semiconductor business or similar area (ideally in the field of electrical/reliability testing)   First experience in using modern software tools and capabilities (preferably Python, LabView, CAD software, and statistical data analysis tools)   Good communication skills and ability to communicate results in a clear conclusive manner.   Fluent English, German is a plus

If you believe you are a victim of identity theft, contact your local police department. Any scam job listings should be reported to whatever website it was posted in.   Jabil, including its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.       Accessibility Accommodation    If you are a qualified individual with a disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access Jabil.com/Careers site as a result of your disability. Please do not direct any other general employment related questions to this e-mail. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to. #whereyoubelong

"Text" : "Supervisor, ProductionSemtech (International) AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:22 August 2024Pensum:100%Arbeitsort:US - Colorado Springs - ElktonSupervisor, Production Semtech Corporation (NASDAQ:SMTC; www.semtech.com) is a leading supplier of high-quality analog and mixed-signal semiconductor products. Semtech is an organization headquartered in Camarillo, California with 31 offices in 14 countries around the world.   Semtech is seeking a Production Supervisor to support the Colorado Springs Elkton manufacturing facility.  In this role, you will be responsible for supervising the production workforce supporting the advanced packaging of wafer and die level silicon products.    Job Summary    Production Supervisor: The production supervisor works in coordination with the Operations Manager to understand the current demands and upcoming needs of the organization. This allows the production supervisor to set goals for daily operations within the fab and direct operator’s priorities accordingly. The supervisor is responsible for identifying obstacles to stated goals and for seeking assistance from management, engineers, and/or maintenance as needed to resolve roadblocks. The supervisor will have a team of operators that report directly to them and will be responsible for. The supervisor must be comfortable directing operators in accordance with company policy and reporting violations to HR. While a strong candidate will exhibit qualities of a leader, they must also be able to perform all operator functions. This means they must be capable of operating a variety of automatic or semi-automatic manufacturing machines including robotic assembly equipment used in the production of the company's semiconductor products.    Responsibilities    Works directly for Operations Manager on all manufacturing related aspects to ensure safe, on time and cost-effective manufacturing execution and delivery. Ensures activities in production area(s) meet production goals and support quality and cost objectives. Works to resolve labor and material shortages, backlogs and other potential schedule interruptions and implement corrective actions to prevent re-occurrence. Selects and develops personnel to ensure efficient operation of the production floor; communicate job expectations; planning, monitoring, appraising and reviewing job contributions. Runs a safe, incident/injury free work environment by following and enforcing standards and procedures, complying with legal regulations. Must be able to work in a clean room environment and follow clean room protocols. Must understand best practices for safe handling of chemicals. Must have knowledge of all OP’s and CARs for audits. Write Work Instructions and Operating Procedures as required. Work with Training Supervisor on training Machine Operators in the Production department Interface with engineering, management, and maintenance Setup and operate assigned production equipment striving to achieve goals for quality, efficiency and productivity. Understand and identify defects in accordance with applicable workmanship. Build trust, value others, communicate effectively, drive execution, foster innovation, focus on the customer, collaborate with others, solve problems creatively and demonstrate high integrity. Maintains reports to reflect scheduling, methods, support performance and process procedures. Perform and direct 5S activities. Oversee daily pass downs from previous shift. Performs the role of a Production Technician in the absence of other duties for the shift. Performs other job-related duties as assigned.     Qualifications:   2+ years Machine Operator experience required or equivalent experience. Broad training in a related field usually acquired through college level education or work-related experience. Must be able to work compressed work shifts as well as possible participation/attendance for meetings/classes on unscheduled days. Standing for 12hour shift Lift up to 50lbs Strong people skills with the understanding that they need to train at the individual’s learning ability. Good mechanical aptitude, vision/finger dexterity and attention to detail Ability to read and comprehend component part markings and polarity. Ability to interpret Engineering Documentation and work instructions. Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook a must Professional and positive communication skills Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision and effectively manage time and priorities. Valid driver’s license required.    Career progression notification for Production Supervisor positions:  Production Supervisors are hired at the level commiserate with their education/skills/work experience and tenure.   We are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace. This position will remain open until filled.   The starting salary range corresponding to the role is as follows:  $55,000.00 - $72,000.00 USD Annual   Benefits include medical, dental, vision insurance, personal time off and other benefits available.  Production Supervisors are non-exempt, are eligible for quarterly bonuses and shift differentials if applicable.

We are a values-driven company with a passion for life at home. Our vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. IKEA Range & Supply has the responsibility to develop, design, produce and supply IKEA stores with home furnishing solutions available to the many people. Our office operates in Karachi as a part of Supply Area South under IKEA Supply.  Job description   You see things a little differently. So do we. We believe in discovering and developing the talent in each of us. We offer positions that challenge your skills and inspire you to grow. Come see things a little differently with us.  We onboard our suppliers as partners with whom we create long-term relationships. We want them to grow with us, become more efficient and achieve lower prices.   You can have the confidence and freedom to do things your own way, including organizing your time. Your well-being is our priority.  A variety of rewarding work awaits you, which you will be able to combine alongside your hobbies or family.  Use opportunities for learning and growth working with suppliers! You will be able to travel to look at various manufacturing companies, understand new and different technologies, people, and cultures.  Everybody is seen as a talent. In regular informal talks with your manager, you can explore your development and carrier opportunities. We will support you on the way by internal and external trainings. We embrace making mistakes and learning from them.  You will work in a small, 3-member micro-team with a Business Developer who negotiates prices and take care of the overall commercial relation with the supplier and a Supply Planner who handles logistics. As part of the annual action plan, you will be responsible for the constant improvement of the quality of IKEA products as well as the production process and workflow through tools such as 5S, Lean, and machine capacity utilization. All with the aim of reducing production inefficiencies, in terms of sustainability and business ethics. You will also perform:   Developing relationships with suppliers – the micro-team regularly travels to the field to understand and solve issues first-hand, you see production from the ground up, help with the implementation of action plans, and cooperate in audit processes,  Secure implementation of new products and update requirements.   Data analytics – this will be a primary function and most of your office hours  Operation – assure suppliers’ competence development in general with a special focus on product documentation update into the system to secure compliance; resolving claims with root cause analysis, regular communication with suppliers, meetings with management and the team; being responsible for quality assurance; leading implementation of new and updated requirements, the running range, product deviation process, risk assessments and secure final inspections at suppliers; evaluating potential new supplier’s production facilities and quality systems.     Qualification  We believe that you have:   Engineering degree, 4+ years of experience in a production environment and process development, including experience with textile and synthetic materials.  Proven experience from Quality & Compliance / Production environment, good knowledge of materials properties, production processes and technologies,  The ability to think out-of-the-box and critically in the constant search for ways to improve our products,  Analytical thinking, which you will use in analyzing processes from the beginning of product implementation to data evaluation and finding improvements, cost savings, better design or quality,  Patience and good communication to help you find common ground with suppliers of different nationalities and to meet IKEA’s business demands,  Fluent in English both spoken and written  The ability to manage time well, to balance between the factory floor and office work   More Information  People within IKEA value a culture of humbleness and open-mindedness. We don't have a rigid hierarchy system and encourage everyone to talk to anyone, and we don't have a dress code. We are characterized by enjoying long discussions and a relaxed, natural order with a great deal of personal responsibility. We want people proactive, engaged, internally motivated for results and eager to learn. The position requires traveling 50-70% of working time and reports to the Business Development Manager in the Textile Products team.  Sounds interesting?  We believe that your value is greater and more important than how much your CV can withstand.  If you are also passionate about home furnishing and if you want to be part of creating a better everyday life to the many customers and do it with a great team, this could be the right challenge for you. We are looking forward to getting to know you soon! Please submit your application as soon as possible but not later than Sep 04, 2024. Please note that we will be interviewing continuously, which means that we may close the application process earlier than stated if we find the right candidate.

"Text" : "Internship Student Project House: digitalization, programming and student support ETH ZürichBewerbenJob merkenAuf einen BlickVeröffentlicht:22 August 2024Pensum:60 – 100%Vertrag:PraktikumArbeitsort:Zürich  Internship Student Project House: digitalization, programming and student support  At the ETH Student Project House (SPH) we inspire and empower students to cultivate a maker-innovator mindset. We believe that by exploring their ideas and developing their own projects, students gain valuable hands-on experience and learn important skills for their future. This is why we’ve created an ecosystem where students (Bachelor, Master, and Doctoral) are encouraged to ideate, build prototypes, test and refine them. Our interdisciplinary team of thirty people supports students with the tools and know-how to explore their passion and create their project. We have a greatly equipped Makerspace that gives students access to the tools and equipment they need to prototype. To take projects to the next level we have a co-working, ideation, and event space and we offer coaching. To specifically support digital projects we provide hardware and software tools, digital know-how and create a community of digital innovators. We're now looking for an intern to join our Digitalization, Software Development and IT group. Read on to see if that might be you!  Project background  You’ll work in one of the most inspiring spaces at ETH Zürich, surrounded by 3D-printers, computers, whiteboards, ideation equipment, self-designed furniture, and plants.  We currently have two locations. Our main location is close to ETH main building, the other one is on Hönggerberg. We work in the same open space as our project teams and meet with everyone at eye level. The individuals we work with are from a diverse range of backgrounds and disciplines, which is why we communicate in English. We believe in open source software and contribute back wherever we can. We collaborate with Google, Microsoft and Amazon to develop new solutions for our students.   Job description  Below is a selection of projects you will be working on:  Create offers to support ETH students and their digital projects:  Participate in the design and delivery of services that empower ETH students with their digital projects Create a hardware (AR/VR glasses, video studio) and software tool portfolio and make it available to students Bring your ambitious ideas to further help ETH students with their digital projects   Extend and maintain our digital tools:  Implement a customized chatbot on our self-hosted infrastructure Evaluate different LLMs to make them available to our students. Design and implement a dashboard to visualize the status of our digital services Ensure our digital services are accessible (screen reader support, etc.)   Digitalization of our processes within SPH. You’ve failed, learned from it, and tried again You enjoy working with people and you’re passionate about supporting them You are able to react flexibly in urgent situations (e.g. if urgent webpage or server problems occur)  A note: research indicates that women and individuals from marginalized groups tend to apply only when they meet all of the criteria. The tendering organization is truly international and located in various locations across Europe. We operate in a dynamic and growing market and are now seeking to strengthen the team with experienced tendering professionals with home base in one of our office locations across the continent.      Your responsibilities  In this role you are responsible for leading tenders from initial request to contract closing and handover to operations. The activities include creating and completing bids/estimations/quotations based on customer’s technical specification and other requirements to achieve both market competitiveness, high quality tenders and profitable business.    Your field of operation will be the substation automation market and you will have the opportunity to handle a variety of tenders in our customer markets. The focus will be either project business or our fast-growing service business and will depend on your interest and experience.    Key activities:   Creation of commercially, legally, and technically optimized and high-quality offers, based on the specifications of our customer. Definition of the scope of supply to be offered. Close cooperation with supply chain management to solicit quotations from subcontractors. Cost calculation estimations and determination of the costs, margins, and sales price in cooperation with sales Tender planning and on time tender submittals Technical support to sales during and during early pursuit stages as well as supporting the contract negotiation. Preparation of tender documents and reports for internal risk reviews and tender submission approvals       Your profile:    Higher education (e.g., bachelor’s or master’s degree) in electrical engineering or similar. Excellent technical understanding of substation automation, control, and protection solutions. Good knowledge of the grid automation market Previous professional experience and good track record within a similar business area Strong understanding and previous experience of tendering and commercial processes would be an advantage. Language skills: Fluency in the local language of the desired job location plus a good level of English is required. Willingness to travel and attend customer meetings, up to 10%

"Text" : "Global Service Product Manager (M/W)Komax AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:07 August 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:DierikonGlobal Service Product Manager (M/W)Komax is a pioneer and market leader in the field of automated wire processing. As a globally active Swiss company, we develop and manufacture series and customer-specific machinery for various industries. We also offer cutting-edge software solutions. Komax includes more than 40 companies across five continents and a worldwide sales and service network. At Komax, you will work in an inspiring international environment where employees are valued. We give you room to maneuver to shape your activities and the opportunity to assume responsibility. Take advantage of our drive as a market leader to bring yourself and the company forward. Together with you, we unlock the world of tomorrow for our customers. We are currently hiring for an exciting position at our site in Dierikon Global Service Product Manager (M/W) Your responsibilities  Overall responsibility for Sales and profitability of the Komax Group Service Business with focus on Service product sales and efficiency (margin) in the operations in the countries. Responsible as a Product Manager for maintaining and developing part of the todays and new Service offerings covering all Komax brands, standardized globally. Tailored to the pain points and need of the main 3 Market-segments Automotive, Industrial & Infrastructure and Aerospace & Railway and considering the special needs and opportunities of the big key accounts. Responsible for the roadmap covering all aspects of a Service Product release like Pricing models, Sales tactics, Marketing, Training, Processes and Systems, etc. Full Sales Force Sales (SF) integration from leads to order, followed by all the SF Fulfillment modules like “Field Management” and “Service” to ensure professional system support for the countries. The efficient execution and the management and support of our workforce is key and leading projects improving the today’s situation in the area is an additional responsibility. (e.g. improving billable hours vs non billable hours, automation of hours collection, lead generation with a 360 degree status report etc.) Responsible for the definition and execution of KPIs and a regular reporting of all relevant information we need on all levels to steer the business. Working in close collaboration with the technology experts from all Komax brands and country organization understanding the markets and the cultural differences. Based on a roadmap defined for each region ensures that all Customer facing people understand and sell the Service Products Cooperate closely with IT Department, the digital development team and other stakeholders  Your profile  Know-how in Product and Project Management ideally in the Service Business and in a industrial environment (deep understanding of the Komax Business is not needed) Engineering with advanced training / experience in business administration and IT Service Mind set and excellent Business understanding Structured and analytical working Conceptually strong with a focus on execution and pragmatism Fluent English, preferably German Teamplayer in a cross functional network Communication & presentation skills on management level Convincing, winning personality High level of self-initiative/ self-motivation Willingness to travel globally (10 max 20%)  Your benefits Your new workplace in Dierikon is newly built and equipped with state-of-the-art technology and work equipment. Your workplace is located in one of the modern open-plan offices, which also have inspiring meeting zones and a large terrace for various employee events. Komax AG offers its employees flexible working time models and home office. Komax AG is committed to the further training of its employees and offers, for example, free internal English courses or access to selected attractive learning platforms. At the Dierikon site, there are also modern break rooms and the option of discounted lunch in a neighboring partner restaurant. Do you have any questions? "Text" : "Project Manager (m/f/d) 80%EAWAG Dübendorf, Eidg. Anstalt für Wasser-, Abwasserreinigung & GewässerschutzBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:26 Juli 2024Pensum:80%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:DübendorfProject Manager (m/f/d) 80%Eawag, the Swiss Federal Institute of Aquatic Science and Technology, is an internationally networked aquatic research institute within the ETH Domain (Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology). Eawag conducts research, education and expert consulting to achieve the dual goals of meeting direct human needs for water and maintaining the function and integrity of aquatic ecosystems.  Project Manager (m/f/d) 80% 
For the two-year cooperative project «Open e-Learning Modules for Open Research Data (ORD) and Research Data Management (RDM)» of the ORD Program in the ETH-Domain, we are looking for a    We offer a varied and challenging job in an international environment, flexible working hours and hybrid working, an open working atmosphere, good opportunities for further training and a modern workplace in Dübendorf. The position is offered by Eawag and is limited to one and a half years.   What exactly can you expect?    Active participation in a cooperative project to create e-learning modules on ORD and RDM Management of the "Knowledge exchange" work package, which aims to ensure knowledge transfer from the RDM teams of the two technical universities ETH Zurich and EPFL to the four Research Institutes within the ETH Domain Management of the work package "Continuous operation and sustainability", which will conceptualise the longterm sustainability for the e-learning modules Contributions to the work packages "Communication" and "Online platform", as well as to the other two work packages depending on the needs of the project Membership in the project's executive committee and support of the project leader in the preparation of content and financial reports for the steering committee    What do you bring to the table?    University degree, preferably in the natural or engineering sciences In-depth knowledge of research data management and, preferably, teaching experience on the topic High affinity to IT-based systems and excellent Office skills Strong communication skills in English; German language skills are an advantage Ability to work independently and in a structured manner, a high degree of service orientation, initiative, and willingness to take on responsibility    Eawag is a modern employer and offers an excellent working environment where staff can contribute their strengths, experience and ways of thinking. We promote gender equality and are committed to staff diversity and inclusion. The compatibility of career and family is of central importance to us. For more information about Eawag and our work conditions please consult www.eawag.ch and www.eawag.ch/en/aboutus/working/employment.   The application deadline is 31 August 2024or when the position is filled.  For further information, please contact Fabian Felder, Groupleader E-Resources & IT Services. You can find more information about the Lib4RI library at www.lib4ri.ch/.   We look forward to receiving your application. Please send it through this webpage, as any other way of applying will not be considered. A click on the button below will take you directly to the application form. "Text" : "Projektmanagerin / Projektmanager (m/w/d) 80%EAWAG Dübendorf, Eidg. Anstalt für Wasser-, Abwasserreinigung & GewässerschutzBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:26 Juli 2024Pensum:80%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:DübendorfProjektmanagerin / Projektmanager (m/w/d) 80%Die Eawag ist das international vernetzte Wasserforschungsinstitut des ETH-Bereichs (Eidgenössische Technische Hochschulen Schweiz). Sie betreibt Forschung, engagiert sich in der Ausbildung und ist im Bereich der fachspezifischen Beratung tätig. Damit verfolgt sie zwei parallele Ziele: den unmittelbaren menschlichen Bedarf an Wasser zu decken sowie die Funktionsfähigkeit und den Fortbestand aquatischer Ökosysteme zu erhalten.  Projektmanagerin / Projektmanager (m/w/d) 80% 
Für das zweijährige kooperative Projekt «Open e-Learning Modules for Open Research Data (ORD) and Research Data Management (RDM)» des ORD Programms im ETH-Bereich suchen wir per sofort eine / einen    Wir bieten eine abwechslungsreiche und herausfordernde Tätigkeit in einem internationalen Umfeld, flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie hybrides Arbeiten, ein offenes Betriebsklima, gute Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und einen modernen Arbeitsplatz in Dübendorf. Die Anstellung erfolgt über die Eawag und ist auf eineinhalb Jahre befristet.    Was erwartet dich konkret?    Aktive Mitarbeit in einem kooperativen Projekt zur Erstellung von e-Learning Modulen über ORD und RDM Selbstständige Führung des Work Packages „Knowledge exchange“, welches den Wissenstransfer von den RDM Teams der beiden Hochschulen ETH Zürich und EPFL zu den Forschungsanstalten des ETH-Bereichs sicherstellen soll Selbstständige Führung des Work Packages „Continuous operation and sustainability“, das die Erstellung eines langfristigen Finanzierungskonzepts für die e-Learning Module ausarbeiten soll Mitarbeit in den Work Packages „Communication“ und „Online platform“ sowie bedarfsabhängig bei den weiteren zwei Arbeitspaketen Einsitz im Exekutivkomitee des Projekts und Unterstützung des Projektleiters bei der Erstellung inhaltlicher und finanzieller Berichte zu Händen des Steuerungsgremiums  Was bringst du mit?    Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium, vorzugsweise in den Natur- oder Ingenieurwissenschaften Vertiefte Kenntnisse in Research Data Management und möglichst Erfahrung in deren Vermittlung Hohe Affinität zu IT-basierten Systemen und exzellente Office-Kenntnisse Ausgeprägte kommunikative Kompetenzen in der englischen Sprache, Deutschkenntnisse von Vorteil Selbstständiges und strukturiertes Arbeiten, ein hohes Mass an Dienstleistungsorientierung, Eigeninitiative und Verantwortungsbereitschaft  Die Eawag ist eine moderne Arbeitgeberin und bietet eine ausgezeichnete Arbeitsumgebung, bei der die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter ihre Stärken, Erfahrungen und Denkweisen einbringen können. Wir fördern die Gleichstellung bezüglich Geschlechtern und setzen uns für eine personelle Vielfalt und Inklusion ein. Die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie sind für uns selbstverständlich. Mehr Informationen über die Eawag und ihre Anstellungsbedingungen finden Sie unter www.eawag.ch sowie www.eawag.ch/de/ueberuns/arbeiten-an-der-eawag/anstellung/.   Die Bewerbungsfrist endet am 31. August 2024 oder mit Besetzung der Stelle.  Für Auskünfte steht dir Fabian Felder, Gruppenleiter E-Resources & IT Services, gerne zur Verfügung. Nähere Informationen über die Bibliothek Lib4RI findest du unter www.lib4ri.ch.   Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung, welche wir ausschliesslich über unser Online-Bewerbungsportal erwarten. Mit einem Klick auf den nachfolgenden Button gelangst du direkt zum Bewerbungsformular. You'll be working as part of a talented software team that works on delivering mission-critical applications in an Agile Devops organization. Your main role will be deploying and integrating a complex core banking system on Azure as part of a major project for a major Swiss bank which will form the foundation of the future modern technology stack. Embrace this thrilling opportunity and shape the future of quality engineering with EPAM. project requirements and objectives  Requirements  At least 5 years of working in a large organization or financial institution, expert in software engineering with a strong focus on Devops A Broad We believe in creating a diverse and inclusive culture with a relentless focus on safety, with a team who are strongly aligned with our core Values and Beliefs and where the success of our people is the key to our business success.  For more information about Millicent:   http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iaZohz5NW_w     It starts with you. Right here at K-C ANZ    You may not have heard of us. But you’ve definitely seen our products, and you’ve probably used them today! Spanning over 300 locations, our notable personal care brands like Huggies, Kleenex and U by Kotex are an essential part of life for one-quarter of the world’s population.   We’re proud of our size, scale and impact. But there’s much more to who we are.   In fact, we’re about people. A role with us is about the care you take, the connections you make, and a rare opportunity - to build an exceptional future for you, our company and the world.    About the Opportunity     This position is located at our Millicent Mill, targeting to commence in October 2024 and will span for a fixed term period of 2 years.  Our Graduate Program is designed to provide the right experience, exposure and education to develop our future leaders and technical experts.  As a Graduate Mechanical Engineer you will have the opportunity to work in multiple departments across the business and gain exposure to World Class Manufacturing.   We want to provide you with a solid foundation and we believe that you’ll enjoy the variety of work, interaction and the opportunities to contribute and make a difference.  You will participate in the Performance and Development Program with a focus on your Development Plan.  You’ll work with a team that provides and asks for feedback by championing a Culture of Accountability.    What you will Do    Build on existing programs related to manufacturing excellence and continuous improvement   Work on projects related to key areas of production lines ensuring KPI’s are delivered across safety, quality, and cost   Take leadership responsibility for delivery of projects through people and cross functional stakeholders      Skills & Experience    Degree qualifications in Mechanical Engineering (or similar)   The right to live and work in Australia   Effective verbal and written communication skills, proficient user of MS Office product suite   As someone with strong analytical skills, you are also able to plan and organise at a high level   Exposure to Lean Six Sigma or similar Root Cause problem identification will set you up for success in our program     To thrive, you’ll also need:    A willingness to collaborate and engage with new perspectives    A strong desire to learn and challenge the status quo   Adaptability and creative thinking    A drive to achieve and take responsibility for fostering change and supporting others       Why Kimberly-Clark ANZ?    At Kimberly-Clark, we’re about delivering incredible results, making things happen, and working together.   There's a reason why we've made the Forbes World's Best Employers list in 2021, 2022 and 2023. Here, our culture of care and inclusion really matters, and so does high performance. We continue to push ourselves to improve. Because we’re proud of how far we’ve come. And we’re excited about where we’re headed.     Here’s what you’ll love about a career with us:    Drive local impact on a global scale: At Kimberly-Clark ANZ, your opportunity is immense. And if you choose to grow with us, so is your potential to have a real impact. We may be a global business, but here, you’ll never feel removed from your work or the results    Win in a culture of inclusion and care: Join us and you’ll find care is not just a word; it’s how we succeed. It’s about keeping ourselves and each other accountable, and it’s about performing to win in a supportive environment    Be bold and own your incredible career: As part of our grad program, you’ll be involved in work that’s diverse and complex. What’s more, you’ll be empowered to own it. That means we’re a great place to get deep exposure and experiences that will set you apart. Where do you want to go?      Total Benefits  Here are just a few of the benefits you’d enjoy working in this role for Kimberly-Clark.   Great support for good health access to a FREE on-site fitness center, occupational health nurse, and our Wellbeing Hub which provides free Health (physical, mental and financial) initiatives to you and your family. We also offer discounts on Private Health Insurance through our partnership with Bupa. You will also have access to our EAP Provider, Grace Papers and Wellness Coach.  Discounted Products to maximize your financial savings across our legendary brands Kleenex, U by Kotex, Huggies, Poise, Depend & More.  Take advantage of our culture of learning with access 100s of online leaning programs and leverage our corporate partnerships with organization such as the Diversity Council of Australia + More.  Support yourself and your community by accessing your volunteer leave that is to support the organization that are important to you.  A winning culture for now and the future You will be joining a company that takes great pride in what we do, and we should, because it’s important. We are celebrating over 63 years of operations in the Limestone Coast, and we are dedicated to our people and our purpose and continuing to provide better care for a better world.    It all starts with you. Are you ready?  Apply today and achieve big things - for our company and your career.  To apply for this role, click the Apply button and complete the online application process. A member of our recruiting team will review your application and follow up if you seem like a great fit for this role.   At Kimberly-Clark, we’re committed to providing opportunities to the best candidates without regard for race, colour, religion or gender identity. "Text" : "Project Manager Service - High Voltage 80 - 100% (f/m/d)Hitachi Energy AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:16 Mai 2024Pensum:80 – 100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZürichProject Manager Service - High Voltage 80 - 100% (f/m/d) 
Hitachi Energy, High Voltage Products, is renowned worldwide as a specialist for power transmission and distribution. The Service unit is responsible for the worldwide after sales support of generator circuit-breaker (GCB) systems and gas insulated switchgears (GIS), including training, installation and commissioning, scheduled maintenance, added value services, troubleshooting, extensions, retrofits and replacements.   Our unit is responsible for extensions, retrofits, replacements of own and third-party substations, including training, installation and commissioning, scheduled maintenance, added value services and troubleshooting. You would be part of an international team, where we support each other and grow together.    Join our team as a Project Manager for GIS & GCB. In this challenging role, you successfully manage the entire end to end process of our projects and you confidently represent the interests of the company towards our customers. For this challenging opportunity, we are looking for someone, who has a technical background with profound experience in a Project Management position and who is motivated to plan, manage and control the project activities with a hands-on approach and international exposure.     Your responsibilities    You are responsible for the successful execution of our diverse projects starting with the handover from sales department, throughout design, production and until the completion of site works   After handover of the project, you coordinate the project team with members from the required disciplines and ensure that each member completes the assigned tasks and work packages according to your project plan   During the project execution, you define and successfully manage all project milestones and ensure the on-time, on-quality and on-cost delivery of our products. In case of deviations, you proactively report to management and initiate the appropriate actions to bring the project back on track   As the first point of contact to the customer you ensure customer satisfaction with your open and proactive communication   With your commercial experience you successfully manage the contract towards the customer   Your tasks include the management of changes in scope of delivery. By identifying opportunities, you actively seek to increase the revenue & margin as well as the reduction of project risks   You share your knowledge, success stories and learnings with the team and keep an open eye to identify, initiate and lead continuous improvement actions      Your background    You combine a technical education in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering with commercial training   You have several years of experience in project management. A PM certification would be beneficial   You showcase a positive mindset and a constructive approach when confronted with complex or urgent challenges   You are business fluent in English and French. German, Spanish, or other languages would be a plus   To be successful in this job you require excellent communication and organizational skills   Ideally, you have experience in SAP as well as product knowledge in GIS and GCB

"Text" : "HVAC Building Applications Developer 80-100%Siemens Schweiz AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:09 August 2024Pensum:80 – 100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZugHVAC Building Applications Developer 80-100% Together with our customers, we combine the real and digital worlds.  Today, most buildings are still far from being perfect places. We have made it our mission to change this. As an HVAC Building Applications Developer, you will help build the next generation of smart buildings for Siemens Smart Infrastructure. Together, we will change how users engineer, operate, and optimize buildings, with a focus on health, safety, and sustainability. You are an HVAC Building Applications Developer with a strong growth mindset, are interested in new technologies, and keen to become an expert in the Building Automation domain. At Siemens, you would join a dynamic and motivated development team working in a professional environment with a highly flexible working model. We want to grow together, foster continuous learning, and provide attractive development and career opportunities. Would you also like to actively shape the future and make a positive impact on the lives of millions of people in Switzerland? Then you’ve come to the right place! Apply today for the role of HVAC Building Applications Developer.   Your new responsibilities   
Design, implement, and validate applications for controlling HVAC systems 
Develop future-oriented building equipment analytics applications 
Be part of an agile R&D team, where you can develop and share your knowledge, mentor other team members, and collaborate with Product Management 
This position offers the potential to grow into a technical leadership role with architectural responsibility and/or team leadership   
  Your skills and experience   
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in HVAC Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Computer Science is preferred, along with excellent analytical skills and a strong interest in building control applications 
Experience in the development of HVAC applications and algorithms 
Familiarity with the latest programming concepts and languages (preferably Python) 
A proactive, motivated, and committed individual who enjoys collaborating with other teams in a global setup 
Ability to adapt to change in a flexible and agile project environment 
Fluency in both written and spoken English is a must; German skills are considered a significant plus   
  Skills and experiences considered a plus:   
Experience in the development of Air Handling Unit (AHU), Heating, and Cooling applications. 
Experience with Function Block Diagram (FBD) or Structured Text (ST) programming. 
Good understanding of Building Automation protocols and standards (Modbus, KNX, BACnet, etc.). 
Knowledge of systems and control theory. 
Expertise in ontologies and related concepts such as RDF. 
Familiarity with methods and services in the context of data analysis.   
  Employee benefits   
2–3 days per week of mobile working is standard 
Mobility allowance 
Varied further training opportunities 
Access to employee share programs 
Further information about employee benefits can be found here 
   What it’s like working for us We place significant emphasis on fostering an inclusive and flexible working culture that encourages everyone to be their authentic selves. Equal opportunities and diversity are important to us and contribute to an enriching corporate culture. We actively embrace mobile working to provide every colleague with more autonomy and the chance to achieve a good work-life balance. Learn more here   Frequently asked questions and contact information Here you will find a collection of frequently asked questions and a way to contact us directly.    I look forward to receiving your application. NathalieTalent Acquisition Partner 
 
 Information for recruitment agencies: Siemens is not accepting applications from recruitment agencies for this position. Thank you for your understanding.

"Text" : "Global Product Manager Damper Actuators 80-100%Siemens Schweiz AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:09 August 2024Pensum:80 – 100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZugGlobal Product Manager Damper Actuators 80-100% Together with our customers, we combine the real and digital worlds.   Siemens Smart Infrastructure connects energy systems and buildings to adapt and evolve the way we live and work through high-profile construction and infrastructure projects such as airports, pharmaceutical plants, data centers, stadiums, universities, military bases, and hospitals We foster an ownership culture, in which every employee takes personal responsibility for our company's success. We trust and empower our leaders to act as owners, advise their teams, and innovate to succeed. We communicate openly and honestly to learn from our failures and celebrate our successes. We recognize individual and team achievements frequently. We invest in our team members, offering a wide variety of internal and external development opportunities In our quest to revolutionize the world’s infrastructure, we’re seeking a dynamic Global Product Manager Damper Actuators to join our Building Products team.   Location: This position can be located in our Zug HQ or in Buffalo Grove (Illinois USA)      The Role   
Identify and prioritize growth opportunities by understanding applications and sales channels, working closely with sales and customers 
Steer R&D to create competitive products while keeping challenging timelines 
Work with sales, customers, and marketing to help define product marketing and go-to-market strategies 
Manage products along the lifecycle incl. phase-out, positioning, and pricing decisions   
  What we offer in this role   
Role with clear growth and development opportunities 
Help and coaching wherever needed 
Chance to make a difference in high-stake projects and have direct business impact and ownership 
    Your Profile   
Bachelor's degree required, Master’s degree preferred or relevant business or technical experience 
Several years of experience in Global Product Management OR similar, ideally with HVAC products 
Experience in leading teams functionally or directly 
Mission-driven, seeking to make a difference, and enjoying also difficult tasks in non-perfect conditions 
Challenging the status quo, i. e. looking for holistic improvement potential and thinking beyond the own job description and tasks 
Builder with strong self-starting drive 
Team player, being constructive, good at negotiating, and seeking agreements 
Outgoing, good at interacting with customers, sales, and R&D 
Strong business sense and customer centricity 
Ideally experienced in design thinking and agile processes 
Someone who prioritizes learning, growing, and making progress 
Structured and organized 
Fluency in English   
  Employee benefits

Opportunity to develop an international professional network
