"Text" : "Ingénieur IA appliquée à la Pile à Hydrogène (H/F)ALSTOM Schweiz AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:01 August 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ProvenceIngénieur IA appliquée à la Pile à Hydrogène (H/F)Ingénieur IA appliquée à la Pile à Hydrogène (H/F)Apply now » Date: 1 Aug 2024 Location: Aix En Provence, 13, FR Company: Alstom Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide Ingénieur IA appliquée à la pile à combustible (H/F) Vous souhaitez relever le challenge de la mobilité Hydrogène et contribuer ainsi à la décarbonation du transport? Vous êtes désireux de participer à l’aventure Hydrogène en rejoignant des pionniers de la pile à combustible en France ? Chez HELION Hydrogen Power, filiale à 100% d’ALSTOM, nous proposons un poste en IA centré sur le développement d'un modèle permettant de prédire un d'optimiser- la dégradation d'une Pile à combustible Hydrogène. A propos du poste Dans le cadre des développements de ses piles à combustible hydrogène, HELION Hydrogen Power, filiale du Groupe ALSTOM, propose à un Ingénieur IA de rejoindre l'équipe R&D pour une durée de 3 mois sur le thème de la modélisation par IA de la dégradation des piles Hydrogène. Vous serez amené(e) à travailler en équipe afin de traiter une grande quantité de deonnées et d'en extraire les modèles permettant d'opitmiser le vieillissement. Le poste est basé sur le site HELION à Aix-en-Provence (13) avec des déplacements ponctuels en France ou à l’étranger. Si participer à la création d’une offre de solutions de puissance décarbonées et participer à la révolution Hydrogène vous motive, ce poste est fait pour vous ! Vous serez rattaché(e) hiérarchiquement au Manager de l’équipe « Stack Design ». A propos des responsabilités Vos principales missions seront les suivantes :  COllecter les données d'un grand nombre de prototype Réaliser les phases d'apprentissage et de prédiction à l'aide de l'algorithme interne Helion Valider la modélisation et optimiser le fonctionnement des systèmes pour améliorer la durée de vie Conclure sur des évolutions dans la stratégie de pilotage des systèmes  A propos de vous Vous êtes diplômé d' Ecole d’Ingénieur avec une spécialité IA et une première expérience en stage dans le domaine du deep learning, et avez un intérêt pour la pile à combustible / Hydrogène. Vous êtes à l’aise dans le travail en équipe, rigoureux et autonome dans la mise en œuvre des procédures, et disposez d’un bon niveau d’anglais. Si de surcroit vous avez une capacité à aborder des problèmes complexes, de façon méthodique, vous serez en mesure de vous intégrer rapidement dans l'équipe au cours de ce stage A propos de nous Vous souhaitez vous investir dans une entreprise à la pointe des dernières solutions du secteur ferroviaire ? L’esprit d’équipe, le sens de l’action et la confiance sont des valeurs que vous partagez ? N’attendez plus pour rejoindre nos 70000 collaborateurs ! Alstom place l’innovation au cœur de son modèle pour proposer des solutions de transport toujours plus propres grâce à ses systèmes intelligents. En nous rejoignant, en plus de relever les défis de la mobilité du futur, vous intégrerez une entreprise engagée dans la diversité, l’entreprenariat, la responsabilité sociale et l’éthique. Grâce à notre implantation dans 70 pays au travers de nos 350 sites, ce sont de multiples opportunités qui s’offriront à vous, en France comme à l’international ! Ensemble, nous contribuerons au développement de la mobilité durable dans le monde. Pour plus d'informations, rendez-vous sur notre site : http://www.alstom.com/ Alstom is the leading company in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose? Equal opportunity statement: Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law. "Text" : "Working Student (ARIS)SAG Software Systems AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:15 August 2024Pensum:100%Arbeitsort:KosiceWorking Student (ARIS)  Software AG simplifies the connected world. Founded in 1969 it helps deliver the experiences that employees, partners and customers now expect. Its technology creates the digital backbone that integrates applications, devices, data and clouds; empowers streamlined processes; and connects “things” like sensors, devices and machines. It helps 10,000+ organizations to become a truly connected enterprise and make smarter decisions, faster.       Our story goes beyond technology.  We put people first – employees, customers, and partners.  We build strong teams and cultivate relationships that last.  We provide incomparable products, solutions, services, and technical excellence for our customers.  We are a team of over 5,000 colleagues across 70+ countries who value inclusion, integrity, and innovation.  Our size means everyone has an impact and every voice is valued.  We are big enough to compete and small enough to care.       Be you, join us.  For our market leading ARIS product line, we are looking for an innovative and independent student to strengthen our team. Support us in further development of our TA (Test Automation) systems and frameworks as a corner stone for our cloud and on-premise offerings. Our test automation and the tested products are based on state-of-the-art technologies like Java, JavaScript, React, Docker/K8s and many more.    Essential Functions    Development and fixing of existing UI tests   Development of our TA systems and frameworks   Development, virtualization and operation of our TA infrastructure   Support the product development teams, if needed   You will be involved in company’s development process – mainly in the test automation part – and enjoy our company culture.      Minimum Requirements    You are a 2nd or 3rd class university student in the field of computer science   You have a strong theoretical knowledge of Java programming language   Your English skills are good enough for communication with our international teams      What’s in it for you?    Friendly atmosphere with good background for your learning curve   Meal vouchers, team and company events   Flexible working time and location   Working for an international company   Standard student agreement with attractive compensation     At Software AG we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect and fairness where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, compensate, develop, promote, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

"Job Title" : "Azure DevOps Engineer"
"Company" : "EPAM Systems (Switzerland) GmbH"

"Text" : "Azure DevOps EngineerEPAM Systems (Switzerland) GmbHBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:02 November 2023Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZurichAzure DevOps EngineerApply  Apply 
Azure DevOps Engineer Description 
ABOUT THE ROLEAre you an experienced Developer with a passion for digital transformation? We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Azure Devops expert with knowledge of the financial services industry and experience in deploying scalable enterprise-grade applications in a complex hybrid cloud environment. You'll be working as part of a talented software team that works on delivering mission-critical applications in an Agile Devops organization. Your main role will be deploying and integrating a complex core banking system on Azure as part of a major project for a major Swiss bank which will form the foundation of the future modern technology stack. Embrace this thrilling opportunity and shape the future of quality engineering with EPAM. 
Responsibilities 
 
Deploying and integrating a complex core banking system on Azure 
Work closely with technical experts, architects and business teams to align technical solutions with functional requirements and strategic initiatives 
Implementing DevOps development processes (version control strategy, code flow, application configuration strategy) 
Implementing continuous integration (code quality, security policies, build strategy) 
Implementing continuous delivery (release strategy, release management workflow, deployment patterns 
Working closely with the Scrum team to understand project requirements and objectives 
 
Requirements 
 
At least 5 years of working in a large organization or financial institution, expert in software engineering with a strong focus on Devops 
A Broad range of Infrastructure knowledge and experience in Unix, Linux, Shell scripting, Database, networking, virtual machines, storage and middle tier deployments with experience in a large-scale global organization on a cloud environment 
Azure Devops or similar cloud vendor certification 
Deep knowledge and experience in Azure Kubernetes AKS, network setup, containerization, cluster setup and high availability configurations 
Experience in deploying applications on Azure via GitLab, Terraform, ansible, helm, tiller, infrastructure as code in a ci/cd Devops environment 
Knowledge and experience in Azure services such as Event Hub, Service Bus, Log Analytics, Azure Application Gateway and Azure storage services 
Messaging, streaming, Logging and Middleware knowledge active MQ, Kafka, Splunk, Prometheus and Grafana 
Development know how Java 8, Kotlin, Spring Boot, JavaScript, React, Restful Api's and Hibernate 
Fluency in English 
German language skills are a significant advantage

EPAM Switzerland was named a Top Company 2022, 2023 & 2024 by Kununu for its people centric culture built on life-long learning 
 Certain benefits and perks may be subject to eligibility requirements  
 
About EPAM 
 
EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential

"Company" : "SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG"

"Text" : "Director of Product Automotive (f|m|d) (80%-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid WorkSMG Swiss Marketplace Group AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:07 Juni 2024Pensum:80 – 100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZürichDirector of Product Automotive (f|m|d) (80%-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid WorkDirector of Product Automotive (f|m|d) (80%-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work  Full-time  Company Description Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and a leading European digital company that simplifies people's lives with forward-looking products. Job Description Join us in this exciting role and support our Automotive team as our new Director of Product and member of the Automotive Leadership Team. About The Role We are looking for a truly business-minded product-driven professional, eager to build performing products, run a team of like-minded people and help us to turn SMG Automotive ( Autoscout24 and Motoscout24) into a racing machine on high octane. The Director of Product is responsible for realising the company's vision by overseeing the development and deployment of web and app platforms. This role requires balancing transparent planning with adaptability to thrive in a dynamic environment. While being a car expert is not necessary, having an interest in the subject and a willingness to learn through direct customer interactions is beneficial. For this reason, speaking German is essential. Experience in a digital / classifieds environment, as well as an affinity for the world of engineers, would be a big advantage. What we will expect from you  Set the strategic direction of the product which aligns with the company vision & growth strategy while improving the customer experience. Own and drive the full product lifecycle from research to design to launch and ongoing optimization. As a member of the Automotive Leadership Team, you participate actively in strategic overarching discussions and decisions. Work cross-functionally with colleagues from Engineering, Business, Marketing and Data teams and leverage expertise from other business areas of SMG. Build, mentor and empower his direct product team including Product Managers, Researchers and UX Designers, and nurture a customer-driven product culture. At the same time orchestrate the scrum teams including backend, frontend and data engineers and BI developers. Create a culture of continuous learning within the product management team, encouraging knowledge sharing, experimentation, and professional development. Develop metrics and KPIs to measure the success of products and identify areas for improvement. Define and moderate roadmap and product planning processes including feasibility, time, cost, and impact and taking new industry developments and opportunities into account.  Qualifications  Experience in effectively leading and motivating product teams across a variety of functional roles. Previously worked in digital environments with a commitment to delivering optimal customer experiences and value propositions. Deep understanding of product management principles, methodologies, and best practices. Past track record of recruiting and developing a high-performing product team. Experience interpreting customer needs, market trends and openness to regular exchanges with customers. Ability to manage multiple products and priorities simultaneously. Experience leading deeply technical product plans and aligning business strategy and technology delivery. Proven change agent and a strong strategic thinker. Proven track record of clear communications with C-suite stakeholders and across cross-functional teams. Data-driven method for decision-making using KPIs and metrics.  But more importantly...  We expect you to be highly motivated to bring us to the next level We want you to take responsibility and challenge us - because we're not perfect We want you to be fair and team-oriented, you should never use elbows or put yourself in the spotlight, it's our teams we want to make shine  Additional Information What you can expect from us  We are a hungry team of professionals who are driven by success We will treat you equally and we expect and empower you to make your decisions We will be honest and give constructive and direct feedback We will provide you with modern tools and everything you need to do your job You will receive a competitive salary Your work location is our office in Zurich Oerlikon but you can also use our offices in Zug, Fribourg or work flexibly from home We organize hackathons, parties, team activities and more fun things to build a strong team  Benefits you’ll love:  6 weeks of holidays (with the possibility to buy up to 10 additional days) 40-hour week 4 months' notice after the probationary period SBB Half-Fare Card You travel 1st class between SMG sites in Switzerland 18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption) Professional accident and supplementary insurance (100% covered by SMG) No fixed office days (you work where you feel most comfortable) Independent counselling center for personal and psychological problems Gender-neutral fair pay with clearly defined career profiles Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + monitor for home) Choose your mobile phone (iPhone, Samsung, Pixel)  Apply now with your CV and any additional documents you think we should read. We are looking forward to getting to know you! LI-Hybrid Disclaimer SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy. About Us SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people’s lives with innovative products. SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI, Flatfox), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24). The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobilière and General Atlantic.KontaktSMG Swiss Marketplace Group AGBewerbenJob merkenDiesen Job meldenWeitere relevante JobsuchenProduct | Produkt Manager Assistent | Junior Produkt Manager | Produktmanagement-Mitarbeiter | Produkteinführungen | Produktemanagement | Product Specialist | Product Management | Produktemanager | Produkt Spezialist | Sortimentsstrategie | Produktmanagement-Assistent | Produkt-Manager | Produktverantwortung | TourismusfachmannKategorien:Marketing / Kommunikation / Redaktion, Produkt-/Brand Management"
